text: Great atmosphere in the bar area during happy hour. By the way, happy hour is from 3-730pm mon- fri. Saturday is 12-6pm. Chuey or Thomas are usually behind the bar. Awesome bartenders. Both these guys exceed expectations. Get the taco basket basket, will not be disappointed.

me and a friend started our night out here. we were surprised when at the bar we were offered chips n salsa! so since we had never been here, we were like, really? so, Tomas, the bartender took the chips n salsa and gave it to some customers who arrived later the we did! we promptly got up, informed the manager what had happened, that I would yelp about it, and we would never come back. so we went a few doors down to a sports grill, where I had a great  lub sandwich n a few beers which ill yelp about next. I wont go back to poor customer service.

This place has definitely gone downhill. It used to have the best Mexican food at a great price. We each ordered the fajitas which now cost $16, and we received a plate full of saut√©ed onions with 4-5 pieces of over cooked meat and a couple of strips of green pepper. Of course we got the usual pile of beans and rice, but we really felt ripped off. We are really disappointed that one of our favorite restaurants has lost its way!
Love the patio. Great service and good food..We Had A Large Party and They Were Very attentibe

Service was good, but the food...seriously the most bland "Mexican food" I've ever had.  I guess it explains so many older folks here for lunch.  I cannot believe it was so bland...wow!  I can make better tacos at home. Won't be back...well maybe one day for drinks on the patio in cooler weather.  I had a taco and a tostada.

Not sure why I keep trying this place. Last time I got the Mexican pizza on happy hour. It was two soggy tortillas with refried beans, cheese and jalapeno cream cheese (which is shockingly bland and salty). I would rate taco bell higher than valle Luna. Everything is over salted.  The menu descriptions make everything sound amazing and delicious. I think hiring a professional menu author (or whatever the process is) is the only thing keeping them in business, besides the location. if you dine in, you may find the place dark and depressing. Employees reflect this vibe as well. I don't think I'll be back, even with all the coupons they send out every month in the clipper.

Ok. The food was fine.  However the wait staff sucks! The guy we got stuck with had a serious problem with what he seemed to want as a language barrier.  And had attitude when we had to ask him to slow down and repeat what he said. When I asked for another beverage he walked away. So I went to the dar to self service, and...wow! Actually got good service. I hate to give a bad review, but the table staff completely sucked.

My Favorite in the east valley. I crave the hot salsa and chips the food is great always served hot . We mostly sit on the patio its nice we can catch the ball games enjoy a nice dinner and relax. You really don't think about the service cause it is fantastic and everything just happens fast and good. Now I am craving the chips and salsa its been a couple days since we have been, and I just asked my better half if she wanted to go again tonight and she said absolutely so we are gonna fit that into our errands and hope to see you there. Enjoy!

I always have a good experience at Valle Luna. Went there for lunch today and had a great time. The service was good. Our server was friendly and attentive, very on top of things. I have not been disappointed in the food either. I usually try something different every time while the wife always sticks her combination plate.

If you haven't been to happy hour you haven't seen the amazing taco basket!  My wife and I love to grab a taco basket, wings and sit outside on a nice day.  Every once in  awhile the rush is so big that the service slows down, but on a nice day- who's in a rush?  While the salsa they give you is tasty - the hot salsa could be hotter.  The price is right during happy hour - the food is good - and the service is on point.

Sorry I decided to stop in. Friday happy hour, bad experience.  Cheese  crisp was greasy, wings were old, chewy, and drowning in sauce. My wife had a mango margarita that was too sweet. She tried a different variety that tasted like soap. Waiter (Diego) comped it , thankfully.  When she got home she puked it up. If you want good Mexican, drive on by this dump. Just because the view is good doesn't mean the food is good. I'll never go back.
Very good chips and salsa. Prompt, fast service.  Will return in future.

Emailed Valle Luna and the owner responded with the results of an in-depth inquiry into what happened at the restaurant. Sounds like an owner who really cares about her business. Very pleased with this response and happy to continue to frequent one of our favorite Mexican food restaurants!

The restaurant wasn't bad but nothing blew me away. The fundido (steak) was good, as long as I didn't think about how many miles I'd have to run afterwards to counteract it. I'm a huge dessert fan and their deep fried ice cream was not something I'd order again (this is where they lost the most points with me). I'll probably eat there again before I make a final decision.
Their host Brandon is always super sweet and welcoming! Such great food..their fried ice cream is amazing!
The pork fundido was delicious ! Pollo tacos always great. My daughter loves the mini shredded beef tacos.

went out To dinner Last Night after son's Soccer game.  Parking lot of Valle Luna Packed as usual.  We Had a really good waitress, Wish I could remember her name.  We Had good time,Good Company, Good Food, and Great Service. I Highly Recommend There Fundido,I usually get there chicken, last night I tried there steak (really Good) and of course don't forget to try Their Margarita's

Mexican food is pretty good and authentic.  The bar side/patio is one of two patios. The second patio does not have TVs you cannot smoke out there. Therefore, the bar side patio is much busier.  Very popular place among the chandler residents. Fun atmosphere.   The happy hour is reasonable, but the selection is bar food.  I would recommend the bar patio for those who want to enjoy a drink, watch some sports, and grub on some wings and papas fritas.  I would recommend the other patio for a more relaxed feel- maybe if you have young children.  The patios are beautiful, because you sit over looking the man made lakes Arizona has. Water is relaxing even if it is man made.

Valle Luna has been our choice for Mexican food for years. Today was the one and only time they disappointed us.  They have added a new menu and when the waiter asked me if I wanted grilled or shredded chicken.  The waiter said grilled is better so I said ok    Without telling me that it was two dollars extra  Just to grill. The point is I felt like I was being taken advantage of for more money. It's not the money it's that telling someone is the right thing. The burrito bowl was so and for the price it's mostly lettuce

I really like their spanish rice and chicken tacos. The salsa is good. The view of the lake is nice. We've always had good service here. The biggest negative is the decor. It could really use some updating. The colors, the dusty tiles...it looks very 80s. I wish they could clear it out and redo with a more modern, simple style.
Great food, great service, great atmosphere. I couldn't ask for a better place to spend an afternoon/evening. Even the late night bar scene is fun! Highly recommended.

i tried thier Sunday morning $2.99 breakfast at teh Cave Creek Rd. location.  The eggs were cold, teh bacon was cold, the sausage was cold.  The fried hash browns were perfect and delicious.  You have to buy a beverage which for me was coffee, it was so so and cost $2.25.  It is served in the Cantina with bartenders doing the serving  For an award winning restaurant I found this to be disappointing.
I'm a regular.  The staff is great with little turn over. The food is good and reasonably priced. Cheap beer! Great salsa!

Accidentally ate here after forgetting that the food is terrible. Ordered a combination plate of a pork taco, a beef tostada and a chicken enchilada. I got a bean tostada that was soggy, a chicken enchilada that tasted like pork and had grizzle in it and a stew like porkish slop placed in a crispy tortilla shell. This time I will remember to go somewhere else for dinner.

Decided on going here tonight with family. Got a table pretty quick. Was prolly 15 mins before the waiter acknowledged, then about 5 more mins until he came back to take our drink and dinner order. Well 35mins later the food arrives, but during the wait not a single word from waiter as to why so long. The waiter during the meal never checked back to see how everything was. VERY poor service this visit. We go here on a regular basis and we are very disappointed.  We ended up talking with the manager about the server, he was very sorry that we had a bad experience and he took care of some of the items on the bill and offered dessert.  Food as always is very good and we plan on still going there for our monthly Fundido fix,

I don't really love the food here, but it's my boyfriends favorite. Our waitress Leah was AMAZING!! Best waitress I've ever had anywhere. Super attentive and anticipated our needs as to extra napkins, spoon for salsa with my tacos, etc. She made me actually like this place.

Poor service, food not that tasty, the best thing they had available was my coke and margarita. It is a cute restaurant but did not meet my expectations at all. They need to go on restaurant impossible ...

Valle Luna is one of the best Mexican restaurants in the valley! The atmosphere is great and all the employees there are very friendly! I recently discovered jalapeno cream cheese sauce over my shredded beef burrito! Amazing! If you're new to Arizona and you want some good Mexican food go to Valle Luna!
The view here is spectacular. You may either choose to eat on the patio or inside but I ALWAYS love to sit by the water and eat this delicious food. I have never been disappointed here yet.
Love this place -  best Mexican food in Chandler. Since Senor comes in second.

Food is about average for Mexican restaurants of the same caliber - Macayos,  Serranos, etc. The atmosphere is what sets this restaurant apart...patio dining with a lake view is fun for the kids or good for romantic evening.

Went for lunch the other day because I had a coupon and I love Mexican food, so I was excited to give it a try. I have to say, I was disappointed. I had the shredded beef chimichanga- it was so-so. I've definitely had a more flavorful chimichanga at a cheaper price elsewhere. I was also not impressed by the service. Our waiter never came to check on us, other than taking our order and bringing the food, which meant we had empty water glasses most of the time. Not cool. But on the plus side, they have a killer bean dip. I'd go back just to eat the chips and bean dip, but probably sit in the bar for (hopefully) better service.

It's been mentioned, however it's extremely true. The bean dip rocks. Lots of Mexican restaurants start you with chips & salsa, but warm bean dip? Leet.  The location of this place is really nice, situated on a lake in the corner of a large complex. For some reason, I like how they are set way back in the corner and their front door is not immediately in front of you at the curb.   I've only been here twice, and I sat in the bar both times. Got pretty decent service, refills took slightly longer than I like but it looked like our server was the only one running around the bar and she was prego, so I'm not really going to fault her. Plus she was super sweet.  I'll be back because of the notable perks I have experienced so far:  Mmm, warm beans. Yes please! They have good happy hour specials, even on weekends (the mini burritos are YUM!)  And they have Michelob Ultra on draft.
Love love love this place!  The service was prompt and very friendly.  I really felt  at home here.  The food is fantastic!  I would definitely recommend this restaurant and I am a serious foodie (:

Arriving at the restaurant, the lunch hour hostess (ink covering her left arm) directed us to a dark corner booth. When asked if we could sit by the windows,  she rolled her eyes and pointed at the empty booths available.  Perhaps she should work in the back of the house instead of greeting customers.    Our server, Christa, was very polite and professional! She did a fantastic job and almost changed our opinion of this visit.  Our order was very good and very hot!    We noticed that the lunch hour hostess was training a new employee.  Big mistake, she needs to be retrained herself!  After coming to this restaurant for about six years, this will probably be our last visit!

Just had the worst experience I have ever had at a restaurant.  Has a very delightful evening with my husband and decided to stop in to one of my favorite places to have a bite to eat.  It was late so we sat in the bar area.  Big mistake!  I felt like I was in a dance club, the music was blaring so loud.  I can get past that.  What I can't get past is the type of music that was playing.  I actually had to ask my husband if I'd I heard correctly.  Yes I did!  F-bomb dropping all over the place!  Very hard rap with very harsh lyrics.  I was completely shocked that my favorite Mexican food restaurant would allow music in their establishment that would have such harsh words in it.  I ended my very lovely date night with my husband very angery and I have Valle Luna Mexican Restraunt to thank.  So Thank you!  We could not get out of there fast enough.  The only reason we stayed as long as we did was the food.  It was as delishes as always. But the food does not make up for my dining experience and will not be back.  2 lost customers.

Went here last night for the first time. Excellent service! Our server Ryan checked on us frequently and always made sure we had what we needed. The bus boy Anthony helped with keeping the chips, bean dip, and salsa full. My girlfriend had the fundito and I had the Fajitas. Both were excellent and well priced (even without a coupon). The lake and lighted fountain made for a next scenery while we enjoyed our dinner. Will definitely be returning soon.
Stopped in for Margs and appetizers.  Had 2 house Margaritas......AM I DRUNK?  Holy MOLY what do they put in those things?  Food was great, drinks were better, I'll be back!

IS IT THE WATER ?  My wife dragged me to this place maybe five times before I finally said enough. The food and service was poor each time. I tried 5 different items on the menu and they all tasted the same (like not good cafeteria food). The atmosphere is OK if you sit by the water. They have a nice Mexican tap beer selection (the best in Chandler unfortunately for me). And this place is crowded too so somebody likes it. I just don't get it.

I love this place! I brought my boyfriend here about a week or two ago because I crave it all the time. I usually get a chimichanga every time. The frozen strawberry margarita was sugary and amazing! The service is great and everyone is very friendly. The food is amazing! We will definitely be coming back :)

Great location right off the lake with indoor/outdoor seating, family friendly (Weds are family night), great Mexican food (yes, its greasy)-with about 10 dinner combos which can please just about anyone, AND we get a buy one get one free through the mail almost weekly that it just makes sense to keep coming back for more! =) Plus their chips, salsa, and bean dip just about seal the deal for me! Yummy!
We normally love your place but why would you not have some kind of specials on margaritas for cinco de mayo?

I've been here before and it was good food and good service. Today was definitely not a very good day. Four of the hosts were crowded at the door touching each other's hair and not welcoming customers or saying thank you. They had attitude as well. Our server looked like she got deal a wrong hand for the night so was unfortunately taking over her problems with attitude and gossip. A whole crew of servers were standing behind our table gossiping. I will not come back here even if i like the food. I am a waitress and there was absolutely no excuse for the service we had tonight.

I have been going here with my family for years but lately we avoid this place. During our most recent visit to this location, the salsa was very watered down and the fajitas definitely weren't as good as they used to be. There was less chicken which seemed to be substituted with more onions and bell peppers. In addition, it took a while for the waitress to greet us and take our drink order. She was not very friendly and we seemed like an inconvenience to her. Thank you for the great food and service in the past but we will be going elsewhere until this place is turned around.
Good food, nice outdoor patio, moderately priced....unfortunatly, service needed some work. They offer unlimited chips and salsa and bean dip, and negro modelo on tap! Amazing chicken chimichanga!!

The food here is just not good. Not that it's particularly bad, but there is much better available nearby. It's bland in the way that wholly Americanized Mexican food always is, and the ambience of the place isn't really appealing either. The people who only wanted chips and drinks looked like they were having fun, but I can't speak from experience on that. The view of the lake is kind of novel in this area, but you're really only looking out over a big pond at some apartments, which gets boring very quickly. In short, I'm not really sure why anyone would want to go here, I'm pretty certain that regardless of what you're looking for, you could easily find better nearby.

The wait for our food was about an hour, but we did have 8 adults and a baby. The waitress, was nice but the food was ok at best and a few of the items were wrong. Our reservation that we made was lost and the person checking me in made me feel stupid that I even would think we had a reservation.

Had a lunch date with my mom there it was great. It was a first time going and we are definitely going back. The lake view was great. The service was efficient and there wasn't to long of a wait. We loved the food and being from Sonora and them claiming that they have sonoran-style we definitely agreed. They're Chimichangas were delicious.
Shitty service from the shitty bartender Tomas.. so I  told the manager we will never be back.

this place is bomb..... been here on several occasions...... with friends and family !!! service is great.... food is delicious ..... perfect place for friends and family .... you van count on having a good time when you eat at valle lunas !!!!
Great Mexican food... Good luck finding a place to park!
I used to come here regularly.  However, after they decided to allow patrons to bring guns into the bar I stopped going.  I simply can't take my children to a place that mixes guns and alcohol.

My husband and I went there before a concert a couple of Sundays ago.  The service was good, the food was good except for the cream cheese appetizer.. I forget exactly what it was called, but it tasted okay but looked horrible, like scrambled eggs or something, we didn't finish it.  Margaritas were good and very strong (which was nice) :) but the ambiance was just barely okay.  Reminded me of an old 80's place that hasn't been updated since.  Probably won't be back any time soon.

Great food, Great service, Great patio on the lake. The cantina side is where we go, every time we're there. The TV's are kind of small, not placed very strategically, but it is a blast for NFL Sunday. Good drink specials, too. At night, on Thurs & Sat, they have a DJ.
This is my family's favorite Mexican restaurant.  Supreme nachos are great.  And so is the shrimp fundido.

Food was awesome, but service was terrible. Asked for extra salsa, never got it for dinner. We were never checked in on after we received food. Also waitress took our receipt right out off our table before the ink dried and had to lean in over our to go boxes to get it. Very rude.
Went there for dinner last night. Men's rest room had lots of standing water (?). LOTS. No the first or second time this has happened.

I am having a hard time finding AMAZING mexican food in arizona.. but valle luna has some tasty bean dip to go along with those thin chips. First impressions make or break with me.. so that definitely helped! I have tried multiple things here and each time i am happy with my decision! mmm and mango margaritas are sooo good!
They have corona light, dos equis amber and negra modelo on draught.  The chips and bean dip are really good.  They have really good enchiladas.

Friends and I were in search of a location...the first two to were duds. One wasn't open and the other was at a hotel bar. My girlfriend suggested this place and I couldn't be happier.  Great atmosphere, wonderful food for a good price. Staff was so friendly and tolerated me during my day drinking session!   Great job!

I usually go here for business lunches although it's not the best idea due to the slow service. It is not the employees fault though, this place is always understaffed - especially in the bar area and on the bar patio.   If you aren't in a rush though and can take your time, bring your patience with you and sit on the bar patio. It is right on a lake and the view is beautiful.   I like how the chips and salsa comes out with a couple salsa bowls as well as a bean bowl. That is different from what I've seen at most Mexican food restaurants.   The fajitas are a good choice and are always very flavorful. If you ask for corn tortillas be prepared to wait about 15 minutes for them. Happens to me every single time, even if I ask for them when I place the order.   The guacamole is fresh and cold from here.   The margaritas kind of suck and have too much mixer in them, but they are cheap so I always order them anyway.   This place is great if you have a Mexican food craving,  time on your hands, and aren't picky about your cocktails. The food is always what brings me back.
Foods alright, but patio atmosphere is worth the trip.
My favorite place for Mexican food. Relaxed by the lake I have never been dissatisfied
I'll agree w/ the other reviewers, average, but I think its gotten  PRICEY for average.  I do love their pollo fundido.

The food here is predictably good, not great. It does not display depth of flavor or creative anything. The portions are large and the view of the cement lake,  well... It's a good deal if you are over 50/55 on a Tuesday the second entr√©e is 50% off, The service is good. Sadly, their signature bean dip is no longer served gratis with the salsa. It is still available but you pay for it. That was actually my favorite thing about the place. The margs are really good and the bar always hopping. They must have a decent happy hour.

I have experienced the best of Valle Luna in 3 very different settings; the typical dinner dining, happy hour, and special event.  Those situations get 4, 3 and 5 stars respectively which averages out to a solid 4-stars.  The food has been consistent all around.  It's much better than the Mexican drive-thru's, not quite as good as Globe food, but pleasing with no surprises around any corners.    Happy hour and the dining room have completely different atmospheres and service.  The dining room was a typical Mexican food restaurant feel, with decent service. It was quiet and the tall booths make it easy to forget about other tables nearby.  The bar (the only place you can get happy hour deals) is loud, crowded, hectic and has had questionable service.  Not horrendous, but I think the servers are stretched too thin.  Getting refills on drinks that come with free refills seems to be a recurring issue... getting a second beer or margarita is not.  The happy hour appetizer menu is hefty enough to serve as dinner, which makes for a good cheap meal!  I'll put up with the bar environment for 3 tacos for $4.  I cannot say enough good things about the private event I attended here...the disclaimer is that I didn't organize it, so I don't know how the back end was.  My future in-laws planned our rehearsal dinner the night before our wedding, and Valle Luna proved to be a perfect venue.  We were out on the patio, right on the water.  It was mid-April so the weather was perfect. The set-up was functional.  Everybody loved the food.  All props to the decorating go to my mother in-law, but Valle Luna was on top of their game with service, ID'ing the appropriate parties, and making the whole event appear seamless to the nervous bride.

American adapted Mexican menu.  I loved exploring the menu until I thought to ask about trans fats in the flour tortillas.  Yes, there are trans fats!!!  Shocked.  How could any local restaurant use an ingredient that goes in; but, doesn't come out: collects around organs and clogs arteries.  I now have to find another American-Mexican restaurant.  Sad.

Although Valle Luna used to rank high on our list, my last visit there has caused me to boycott this restuarant.  I will summarize the story, as I don't like to draw out details.  I am a very forgiving and patient person but this incident was truly an example of extremely poor customer service.    After my mother passed away, my friend gave me a Valle Luna Gift card.  Eventaully, because it was emotional, I used it with my family.  After I tried to pay using the gift card, the waitress returned to tell me that the card was not activated.  I asked to speak to the manager and she advised that she would look into it on Monday.  2 weeks passed and I decided to follow up on it.  The manager than had conflicting comments, but bottom line, she cannot do anything to help me unless I have the receipt.  I explained, as I did the night we dined there, that I did not feel comfortable asking my friend after 3 months of receiving the gift since the chances were very low that she would still have the receipt.  Also, it made me very uncomfortable that if she didn't that she would then feel bad.  In short, the manager advised that if they honored everyone's gift cards that were not activated then they would be out of business.  She basically was accusing me of trying to use a stolen gift card.   I asked her to please check with the owners to make sure they agree with her decision to do nothing.  She did email the response saying that there is nothing that can be done and oh, very sorry for your loss.  (talk about salt in a wound).  A little more background:  We have been a very loyal and regular patron of Valle Luna for as long I can remember, well over 10 years.   On average we spent $1200/year there.  So, we have spent at least $12,000 over the past 10 years.  Value of the gift card:  $30  Interesting business model employed.  And this coming from a restuarant that has buy one get one meal coupons abundantly.
The service at this restaurant is very poor. The wait to get a water is too long. The waiters generally get your order incorrect. The food doesn't make up for the terrible service they provide.
Chicken fundido is amazing. Spinach enchiladas are awesome. Salsa was awesome too. I love eating there.
Shrimp Fundido - awwwwwwwwwwwwwsome.  Great service, good food.  Glad there is one so close by!
Always great service. The food is also good and well prepared.  Prices are very reasonable too. I have been here many times with my wife. Chicken or beef enchiladas and flan for desert.
This place is good. Love the people and the drinks. Food is always hot. You will leave with a smile on your face guaranteed. Try it out just once you will see.

This was my first time here. There was one hostess that was really nice. The other girl who took my to go order was in a MOOD lol. The food tastes delicious but I'm annoyed that the moody chick told me the tacos were really big so I only got one instead of 2. Well it wasn't and all I have left is a tub of beans and tortillas chips. I'd go back because it tastes good but maybe I won't have the $9 taco lol

I'm torn about this place. Beautiful patio, great food and drinks, and even better prices. But in the years I've been going, I have only had one positive experience with the service and server's name is Brittany. If she isn't serving me, I have a server who clearly doesn't want to be there or serve me. I'm having to wave them down to even get my water refilled and not treated like a guest when they are at the table. I don't want to stop coming here, but I also don't know if it's worth it.
The Mexican Pizza with chicken was delicious! Nice view of lake and a good vibe for some playoff football.

Fundito was good...not great.  I got it with pork.  The pork was cooked perfectly...nice and moist.    My wife's bean & cheese burrito was bland (at best).  She wasn't impressed at all.  The salsas (both mild and hot) were flavorless and runny.  The hot tasted like Ketchup with a small bit of spice.  We even had some of the bean dip...not so good.  The chips were greasy too.  Valle Luna used to be some of the *BEST* Mexican food around... What happened?!?!?!?!
Valle Lune is awesome. The Mexican pizza, tacos and potatoes skins were awesome. Go for Happy Hour! Mango margarita was strong -loved it!

I want to give a shout out to our server Brittany. She was awesome! It was happy hour on Tuesday night and the place was really busy. Not only did she NOT write our 6 person order down, but she got everyone's food correct and was very attentive despite them being busy. Good with bringing drink before you ran out. :)

The tortillas that they use for their chips and tacos are fantastic and some of the best I have ever had.  The rice is good with a perfect amount of cumin.  If you go when the weather is nice you can sit outside right by the lake, and if the kiddos are at home it makes for a romantic night out.  I have been here three times, and although it's not "wow gotta have" it's a safe bet that the food is consistently good.

Came into town from Florida and wanted to take my husband's staff out to dinner (party of 10) we had Jessica as our server and what a great server she was handled our order like a champ, kept our drinks filled (bar drinks and non) orders were all perfect! Great server and service will definitely be back next time we are in town!

Valle Luna has been my go to Mexican restaurant for 2 years now. Tonight I had the pleasure of having Brian as my waiter. He gave the best service I've ever received at this restaurant. Very laid back and genuine! he also gave excellent advice for the different meals my group was ordering, for example he recommended the grilled chicken for the taco salad which was amazing! On top of that he was fast and always made sure we had everything we needed- never left us wondering where our server was.
Large portions, great taste but the service is a bit lacking.

This place is awesome for happy hour.  You can get a dozen wings or a taco basket, add a  Mexican import beer, free chips and salsa plus bean dip. All this for $8.50. You can up the beer to a 32oz for just $1 more.  The food is very good, I was very happy and returned the next night to try it again.  They have a nice menu for happy hour, I have tried the wings and the taco basket, they were both excellent. Have to go back and try some of the others soon!

I'd like to give it no stars. The food is all right super greasy but Okay for a few chips and Margaritas. Oh and  the only place worth sitting is the bar. The front hostesses are total C U Next Tuesdays. We walk in late on a Sunday night after painting and we are tired. Bar is full so we go to leave. The hubs says let's get a table. We ask for a table, not one of their super uncomfortable booths. The hostess tells us there's not a table available except on the patio. It's 45 degrees out. While the staff is sitting waiting for patrons at tables. When I say can't we sit there she just stares at us.  Never going back.

Colleagues from India, UK, NY and locally enjoyed Valle Luna.   While no table was promised, a table for 7 overlooking the "Lake" was ready when we arrived.  Good authentic margaritas. Abundant chips and salsa with an appetizer of guacamole. Made two ways, one regular and one hot.  We chose Fajitas, Chili Relleno, and chicken enchiladas.  Larges portions, most (but not all) staff were friendly , and good value.  Outdoor seating with view of lake...perfect for the cooler evening.  Moment of humor: one colleague ordered a drink of Baileys Irish Cream on ice. Order was met with disbelief. Two people came out to double-check that's what he really wanted. Guess they don't get too many orders for this stuff.  PS Can't say how Valle Luna compares with other area Tex-Mex...but infinitely better than anything in NYC.  Would return. See pics.

Horrible customer service. Took my father there for his birthday.  When the food arrived, he was the only one that didn't get his food. It took 15 minutes to flag the waiter and when we asked about his order the server lied and said it would be 3 more minutes. After another 15 minutes we asked again and were now told that his order "somehow ended up on another ticket and it would be another 20 minutes".   The rest of the table was now finished with their food.  When my husband asked to speak with the manager, the manager defended the server and told us if we didn't sit down and be quiet he would call the police! Needless to say my poor father's birthday was ruined.

Here for lunch during week day. I ordered chicken burrito lunch special with green Chilli source. I asked to put the cheese aside not on top of the burrito so it doesn't overrun the Chilli source flavor. Also asked for the whole bento bean instead of refried. It was a delightful lunch! Didn't touch the cheese at all.

Literally the worst Mexican food I have ever tasted in my life ( until I went to Macayos!!!)  So now its the second worst Mexican food I have ever had.  We had an appetizer that was overcooked or over deep fried little tasteless burritos that were supposed to come with a bean dip that didnt come til we were done with the appetizer.  When we asked for the missing bean dip our waiter got a bit defensive about it.  It was so bland and tasteless anyway and we didnt eat it. We had a chili relleno that was just awful.  It was swimming in oil, a thick slick of oil.  Very weird feeling in your mouth.  I almost vomited literally but instead I spit it out in my napkin.  I had a combo burrito and taco and the taco was in the deep fryer so long that the edges of the meat were black and the cheese they stuffed inside never melted so it was a weird combo taste texture.  The burrito was about the best thing but still the worst I have ever had.  There were lots of tiny pieces of what appeared to be red peppers and green peppers as well as onions in the meat mixture but it seemed to be old as if it had been in fridge or left over a couple days.   Someone else said that the beans were like play dough and yes thats a good description! The chips and salsa also not that good.  Salsa wasnt the worst but not that good and was definitely not fresh or made by them and the chips were so brown they were almost burnt.  The waiter was a bad mood jerk.  The atmosphere is absolutely beautiful with the lake and the fountain all lit up at night.  Gordon Ramsey really needs to make a visit to this place.  I cant believe they are in business since 83 and that people recommend this place.  What are they thinking????

UGH.  One, they don't honor groupons or restaurant.com certificates on any happy hour items. Two, the food is definitely not the best Mexican in the area. There are far better places within a block or two.   It's overpriced and definitely not easy on the stomach. We had margaritas, beer, the chicken nachos, and some 1/2 taco baskets. Today, all three of us have some serious stomach issues. The nachos were large (and for $15 they should be) but they had cheese, onions, refried beans, jalapenos, chicken, and sour cream. We had to ask a number of times to get our salsa refilled (there was never enough, and only one brought each time). The tacos didn't taste like much, just deep-fried shells without much flavor.  The ONLY thing I liked was that refried beans are served with the salsa and chips.   Go anywhere else.

Terrible service from Esteban, no pre-bussing, no refill on pop, we sat for over 5 minutes before we were acknowledged, and he walked by the table 3 times.  Chicken wings were overcooked and extremely dry. We split a taco basket 1/2 chic, 1/2 beef, very bland, no seasoning to the meat at all. The veggies for the wings were old and dry and obviously old by the fridge burn on them.  It's a great patuo, and the cocktails were good, too bad the food and service were awful.  Lastly it states it's non-smoking outside, there were several ashtrays next to us, full of butts, definitely un-appetizing.

I loved sitting outside (with the misters on!) and enjoying the company of my daughter with delicious food. We were served right away and the restaurant looks clean. Can't wait to take the hubby over!
Too many birds on the back patio.  It's to bad because the view is wonderful.

UPDATE***Jesse, the manager, followed up and was very professional and apologetic. She assured me this was not their standard practice. I feel she handled it very appropriately and we will definitely give Valle Luna another chance. Besides, they do have amazing food and I would hate to swear them off forever:)

it's a winner.  make sure you sit outside on the lake and order the mini taco basket split between 2 people.  free chips, salsa and bean dip are plenty especially along with the ritas on the rocks.  it's also a kick azz happy hour because the apps are half-off.  the food is cheap and super good.  don't try and walk around the lake though.  it doesn't connect up in a full circle.  and don't swim in that sh*t either.  just eat the good food at valle luna:-)
Best food, drinks and service. My wife and I love this place. Thanks

I love this place! Sits right on the lake offering a beautiful view of the fountain. The restaurant is appealing with the authentic mexican look. The food is good. The service is good. Avoid Friday and Saturday if you are looking for quiet dining

The lake view is what brings my friends and I to this place for an occasional dinner. Place gets packed so we try to come later than the prime time dinner rush. That really works best on the weekend when the hours of operation are a little longer. So... I've tried a lot of their dishes - Fundidos, Shrimp Enchilada Dinner, etc but once I tried their Shrimp Stuffed Poblano Chiles - that was it! I could never try another dish off their menu. Like the pathetic and predictable crack addict that lives for the next hit I come here and predictably get that each and every single time. I mean it comes with everything I love - shrimp, calabacitas, chiles, melted Monterey Jack cheese and jalapeno-lime cream sauce. So Valle Luna, don't you ever ever ever ever ever take that off the menu or I will walk out of your restaurant for the last time ever after throwing a tantrum that would have even embarassed John McEnroe back in the day. One valid complaint that I'm not alone in (judging from OTHER reviews) is they stopped serving the bean dip with the chips. Now it's just the blander salsa that the chips come with. And now they charge a kidney for the beam dip if you still want it. Well not really THAT much - it's more like just a big toe or something. But they used to give it for free as part of the complementary chips and dip. For that I dock a star - since that awesome dip was a mandatory part of the complete Valle Luna experiece. Lots of parking - shares a mall with Nate's Third Base, Sprouts, Hon Machi Sushi, Coffee Rush, and Pita Jungle.

good quality food which is why i return but the last few times that i have came i sit at a table for 10 minutes with no service. the first time i left, this time i finally got my chips and salsa before i can leave so i stayed. I don't know my waitress's name and i've been sitting here ready to order with my waitress nowhere to be seen. it sucks that i love coming here for good food but horrible service.  i completely understand busy hours but i don't understand waiting 10 mins before being attended to.

I always forget this place is here.  It has probably been 15 years since I have visited Valle Luna.  I was looking on my nav system for a new place to take the kids and rediscovered Valle Luna and I am glad I did.  It was very busy when we went in, there was an ASU game and the lounge was very boisterous.  The kids enjoyed the view of the lake.  I can vouche for the chili verde pork enchiladas and my grill like there ground beef tacos with rice and beans (they said the tacos weren't as good as what mom and dad make though ;) but they ate it all up.    Chips are bean dip are similar to Serrano's and the kids really liked them.

We found our recent dining experience to be most excellent.  The food portions are huge - I could enjoy seeing some smaller meal choices for a less expensive price.  In my opinion, the best value on the menu is the Pollo Sandwich - if you like chicken.  It is easily enough for two people.  I had cheese enchiladas, which were very good, but a bit too cheesy and needed more sauce.  Overall, I would definitely recommend this restaurant.  I hope to have room next time to try some delicious fried ice cream.  Yum!
Have eaten here many times with my family.  Good food at reasonable prices.  Usually packed on the weekends.  Service is just ok. Parking is difficult on the weekends but we will return :-)

Great homestyle Mexican food. If you like heat, order the pedazos, which are actually considered an appetizer but the serving is so big it can easily be shared. It's this delicious pulled beef/chile combo stuffed inside a giant,  cheesy quesadilla. Heaven. Eat it with the mexicali relish and it's game over. Its the only thing I order. Love the bean dip and chips, too.   Service can be a little hectic,  but I've seen most of the waitstaff always just hustling and bustling all around so I think that's why, and I'm fair when taking that into account. Maybe add some staff to take the pressure off? Wait times suck during peak hours (Friday night, for example.)  It's certainly not gourmet but it hits *the* spot when you get that naughty-bad-for-you-good-for-the-soul-craving for Mexican food.
Great place, love Brittney, Tomas and Chuey.  Food is always predictably decent, service is really great.  Awesome view of the lake, great patio.  We love this place!!
Food was better then I expected to be honest. Would go back for sure if I was in the area. I got the spicy matcha burrito. Super spicy
Just went in for the first time and had the Fundido! It was so good, definitely the best I've ever had. I would have given 5 stars but the servers weren't particularly friendly or attentive.
Visiting from Pa...great food great service. Sat outside

This is the only mexican food place that i actually get excited to eat at! I have tried various dishes, but the best thing to get in my opinon is the carne asada burro dinner! I get it with no red sauce and a side of sour cream! It is so good!  Today there was no wait and the chips, salsa, and bean dip was placed on the table right away. The server arrived and was pleasant and got our drinks fast!  Other person with me got a #8 which is two tacos. They were ground beef and they stated it was the best tacos out here in AZ!  See corresponding photos and make your own judgement if you can from a photo! If you haven't been it is highly recommended!
If there was a zero star option I would choose it!  They messed up tacos, how can a Mexican place mess up tacos???  The service was very slow and snarky. I don't think I would come back here again!!!

This place has an amazing dish called 'pollo fundido' which is Spanish for 'fun happy chicken' according to no one.  Anyway the dish is super tasty with like chicken burrito married to a cream sauce and it's super good and you should try it.   Good luck intrepid traveler.

My family from my 30-something kids to the grandkids all love Valle Luna. The service and food is excellent. I've tried almost everything on the menu and have not been disappointed. The happy hours there are awesome and happy hour selection is second to none My family and I would eat there every day if possible.

Me and my husband have been going to Valle Luna since they opened in Ahwatukee, well they closed that one because the rent was so high. Then we starting coming to this location. Well not impressed at all, they have some hostess at the front to seat you, not pleasant at all, seems like she hates her job. Then we sit outside then our order got messed up because our server didn't write it down to begin with. Then the food quality just so so. Not sure what happened if they sold it to new owners or what. Or their kids took over but the food is not good anymore, then they changed the green chili to make it hotter. WTH it was good to begin with that's why people come back. We decided after this last trip, not going back.
Been coming to Valle luna since I was a kid.  Awesome food! Their flower chips are so yummy. Also, great salsa which is important at a Mexican food joint. No complaints on service either! : )

Came for drinks and food on a Sunday afternoon at the bar top, had a blast.  Had 3 margaritas and the wife had the nogales iced tea! The bartender, Tomas, was friendly, attentive and super helpful to my wife's allergy needs.  He was informative and as a plus to our needs, our cocktails never hit the bottom of the glass. The food was delicious, in fact, i was a little uncomfortable for a few hours since i drank and ate so much.  This was our first visit and we will be sure to return, definitely want to sit on the patio by the lake when the weather gets better! Thanks again Tomas for the fun afternoon.
Wings at happy hour and tacos are really good.  ask for the wings to be grilled you won't be sorry. yum .

I ordered the tamale dinner, one of each with refried beans and rice.  The green corn tamale was excellent maybe one of the best.  The filling of the pork tamale was stringy pork, good but too dry.  The masa was great however.  The rice was salty which I enjoyed and the beans were perfect.   It is true, they no longer serve bean dip, and the house salsa is sub par.  Better to ask for hot sauce with the chips.  It was busy, but they did a good job with seating and service.  Would like to go back soon.

This place has a great happy hour that lasts till 7:30! Great drink specials and half off of appetizers. I had two drinks and the guacamole,  which was perfect. My server was prompt and attentive even though it was packed in there. I wish there was more patio seating for the bar area. The patio seating for the restaurant was empty but you cant get the bar specials if you sit there.

Food is good, a bit of the greasy and messy side. I went around the end of the lunch rush and it was quick to get seated and order in. The food took a long time to come out and the waitress did not check on us to refill drinks or anything. We probably waited about 20 minutes for the food to come out. That seems like a long time for a lunch rush. Overall food is good, and typical, value was on the average side.

This was my first time here - my date suggested it after church. Holy Schnikees! The location has a waterfront view - both inside and on the outdoor patio. Beautiful for these parts! The ambiance was well sculpted - each booth is given to privacy. The server we had, Bri, was fun, friendly and helpful! My date had a Vegetarian dish similar to a Fajita. She thought it was excellent! I had the pork Fundido and brother, let tell you, WOWSER!!! A little bit of deep-fried jalape√±o cream cheese heaven was sent my way!  For the food, for the view, for the fun and the helpful service - 5 stars!!! Solid!

After 15 years I have yet to be disappointed.  Valle Luna "gets it!"   Upon entering you're greeted by all staff members you see, seated promptly, salsa and chips hit the table almost instantly, and your server appears in short order.  Next is deciding  what to order from a considerable menu.  It won't matter...It's all good! Whether dining in (lakeside please weather permitting,) ordering take-out, party trays or catering, you'll be happy!  And they're local and family owned...Huge!!

I've been going to Valle Luna ever since I can remember!! They have awesome salsa but not awesome chips. The bean dip is a hit or miss, it depends on who makes it that day. The pollo fundido is my favorite... even though it cost like $15 and an extra $3 for a side of the jalapeno cream cheese. I also recommend the pollo sandwich and the grilled honey-hot wings! Now about the service... it's terrible!!! A lot of the servers have worked at Valle Luna for many years and treat NO ONE with respect. They treat customers like they are an inconvenience then wonder why they don't get good tips lol.
Food was good, parking is a pain in the tukas.... You get what you expect at Valle Luna and no complaints from us, wife did think her Pollo Fundido was lacking in flavor thou.
Kid friendly and nice views of the "lake". Friendly atmosphere and good food. Come hungry as portions are decent. Kids menu is decent with a variety of kid options.

Tried this out because of the rave reviews.  Not what I was looking for and we won't be back.  If you want Americanized Mexican food with many fried things or drowning in cheese you will like it here.  There was a ton of cheese on the salads (iceberg lettuce), twice as much as other places that do lots of cheese.  Got the shrimp stuffed poblano chiles - pepper had nice flavor and shrimp plentiful and nicely cooked but again a ton of cheese that overpowered the dish and could not taste or see other ingredients.  No lime crime sauce - maybe cheese buried it or it was forgotten.  Friend got chile rellano - it was ok but nothing special and again lots of cheese.   The meals could have been much better with small changes (use Mexican cheese not American cheeses), don't drown things in cheese (covering up a dish not that good?).

Not sure what happened to this place ..I would say either the managment crew is mismanaging or hiring the wrong people but the food was awful and the Bar staff are just rude. I will not spend a penny more in this establishment!

OMG, this place is amazing! We had a hard time finding a table for 7 of us and ended up with something less than pleasing.  The female waitress was irritated with me and you could tell she clearly did not want to wait on us, so a young waiter, I think his name is Jeff, took her place.  He was wonderful, catering to our every want and need, the food was, of course wonderful.  We will continue to come here; however, avoiding the waitress with the attitude problem.
Ate in the cantina area, my waitress Erin was amazing. She was super efficient, attentive, and sweet! Steak fundido=phenomenal. Great place.

Valle Luna bats .250.  Not high enough to put in the middle of the lineup (hell, probably not enough to even start), not low enough to send back down to AAA.  Completely average.  I'll admit, however, to frequenting the restaurant primarily for its bar which seemingly promotes about 17,696 drink specials and more on football sundays.  Other than that, there isn't really a whole lot to say one way or another.  Perhaps that says more than a lengthy review ever could...

I have been a Valle Luna fan for over a decade now and finally found a location close to me again. I brought my wife here for the first time and she LOVED it. this is our new GO TO mexican restaurant!!!

One of my favorite places to eat! They're usually super busy but for good reason. They have awesome happy hour deals and dishes in general! My favorites are the wings, quesadilla, cheese crisps & the FISH TACOS!!! Ugh to die for! Love this place! The staff is also friendly.

For anyone who gives this place five stars-I seriously question your taste buds.  This is the Hometown Buffet of mexican food and it left both my friend and I feeling extremely ill.  If you want to spend a lot of money for canned food, then Valle Luna is perfect for you.

Normally when my husband and I visit Valle Luna we split an order of the fajitas and order the queso dip. Last night we had a buy one get one free coupon so we got separate orders.  They were pretty much was the same thing except I got the smothered burrito and he got the enchiladas. I thought that the meat was a little spicy for me but I still ate it. The burrito skin was not warm at all and it was pretty dry. My husbands enchiladas looked better than my dish!  Also I ordered guacamole with mine-$2.50!   I'm sure we'll come back, but next time I'm ordering the fajitas and queso dip!!!
I started with the complimentary salsa, re-fried beans, and chips followed by my margarita and chicken taco basket everything was really good def one of my favorite mexican restaurants :) !

Where to start? I came in on a Saturday to a semi busy atmosphere. There were 2 hostesses at the front, one very friendly and the other indifferent to be there - which is ok, sometimes you have off days. Opted to sit outside where the view of the pond was nice along with the weather. Our server may have been new as he misheard or misremembered part of the order and then charged the wrong amounts for our checks. The most disappointing parts of the visit had to do with the high prices and charges for every little thing. My friend ordered street tacos that did not include any type of sauce unless an additional $1.25 was paid. Just not what was expected..

This is probably one of my favorite restaurants of all time, the food is always fresh and hot, and the wait staff are always nice. Order the quest it is worth the extra couple bucks and the tacos or fajitas you can never go wrong.   We actually just used these guys for catering of a party of 80. It can out to about 6.25 a person with left overs yessss.   I will always come back here

Ordered Fiesta nachos ( total disappointment ) albondigas soup, chips a salsa ( salsa tasted like canned tomatoes with a little cilantro and onion ). The nachos were soggy and loaded with tasteless shredded chicken and beef. Soup was slimy and the meatball tasted like un-seasoned hamburger, the only thing that was good was the cold beer !

Had lunch here this week, great as always.  The tables are all booths, and the restaurant showcases a waterfront view for many of the tables.  I love the decor and atmosphere, food and service.  It's clean and the people are friendly and efficient.  Food was fresh and excellent, and salsa and chips.  Excellent service from the server Krystle, who was prompt and attentive.  I have been going here for more than a dozen years and it never disappoints.  Their margaritas are excellent so are happy hour deals and the senior nights 2/1 (I think Tue).  They have a great lunch special menu too, that is easy on the wallet.  Overall I rate this restaurant highly and consistently.

sadly, i can't let my old review stand. i hope no one went there based on that review. idk what happened butttttttttttttttttttttttttt our food this last time was not good.   the beans on my friends plate looked like dried out play-do. it was really gross to look at from across the table, not gonna lie. and the lettuce on her plate was brown and wilty. i couldn't handle it.   my food had this weird flavor and honestly....  everything had a weird taste, even my diet coke.  we both agreed everything had a funny taste. idk what it was. i was sad bc last time my dinner was so amazing. i probably won't be going back for awhile. or ever, i haven't decided.

Valle Luna has exceptional Mexican food that is always fresh and delicious. The Chicken Fundido is one of my absolute favorite menu items and I have not found another Mexican restaurant in the Valley that can beat it! The jalapeno cream cheese sauce is TO DIE FOR!! The chicken in the fundido is actual whole grilled chicken breast, fresh and cut up..not the shredded soggy meat that you can get everywhere else. They give you chips, salsa and bean dip before the food comes.   The Happy Hour prices for Margaritas aren't great (around $5.50) but they taste great and I usually only have one for my entire meal. I go to this location at least once a month and the longest I have had to wait to get a table in this establishment was around 5 min. They have a bar area, restaraunt and patio which makes for a lot of seating. If you sit outside on the patio you will be on the waterfront where there is a cool fountain and some ducks that run around.   The prices compared to other good Mexican restaurants in the Valley is about the same. You get what you pay for though...quality food. I took my whole family here for my college graduation and every single person loved the food. My mom is not a huge Mexican fan but she is hooked on the taco salad!

All I can say is that the reviews connected with this restaurant have to have been written by friends of the owner. If I could have given this place no stars, I certainly would have. Never had I had a more terrible dining out experience than at Valle Luna. I just arrived in Arizona from NY and took my family to dinner there. Six of us sat down to dine and we went to order. Last year I had the best chili relleno dinner here, so I asked for it again. Sorry ma'am, you have to have a taco instead of the two chilis! Why said I, I don't like tacos, can't you just charge me for a second chili. No substitutions! Just take off the taco and put on a chili, don't you want your customers happy? My granddaughter heard him mumble, for a price and for a price it was! Instead of charging me for one chili, they charged me for double chilis, beans and rice...18 bucks for two soggy cheese chilis! Where last year they were crisp and hot and delicious, this year they were two drowned out soggy cold messes lying mixed in with the beans and rice, drowned in tasteless watery sauce. I asked for the manager and Carlos, the manager came to tell me...tough! We have rules. We don't change things! I said don't you care about customer satisfaction? He said, we have rules! I said I guess you don't care about your customers and he shrugged. That says it all! Tasteless soggy food, nasty manager, greasy plates at the table, uncaring waiter..including the one who elbowed me as I left the restaurant. All this for 118 + dollars. Enter at your own risk! I'm sure there has to be better Mexican restaurants in the Chandler area, or at least ones that actually care about their customers.

One of our favorite places. Such a great happy hour and patio. This may seem weird but they have the BEST wings ever. I don't usually eat wings but I can't get enough of the hot grilled ones from them.   Tomas is awesome and always has great suggestions. The rest of the staff is amazing also. I could go on and on but seriously try the wings or fajitas and wash it down with a margarita on the rocks.   The cantina and patio are where it's at. Also don't forget to try the wings.

My boyfriend and I come here all the time! Sometimes when the bar is too full we sit in the regular dining, and let me tell you, I definitely don't recommend it. If you want good service, SIT IN THE BAR! The bar servers know what they're doing. To name just a few: Julie, Alexis and Brittany. Everyone we've had is AMAZING. My favorite drink is the coronarita and we both love the chicken tacos. If you want a good time and over the top service, sit in the bar. You'll have a great time. If you sit in the regular dining area, don't expect great service. 5 stars goes to all the servers in the bar and the bartender.

Great place for Mexican food. We visit on Tuesday nights for senior night. This is a terrific value with 2 for 1 meals. Sometimes it's good to be a little maturer. The chummy is my favorite. It is not over cooked and is large enough for 2 meals. All the food is very well prepared and the service, even with a larger crowd is great. I have eaten here for many years,  even before I was eligible for the special. This place has always been a great stop.  If you are one of the fortunate to be able to partake in senior night remember that your tips should reflect paying for 2 meals. Let's not short change the wait staff.

Large restaurant with a view of the lake, plenty of indoor seating, outdoor seating, and a separate bar area.  Great salsa, good food, excellent Pollo Fundido.  The margaritas are decent as long as you don't get the house margarita (very cheap tequila).

4 friends enjoying mexican.  We walked in around 8 o'clock on a Friday night and had no problem getting a table outside.  At first glance, I prob. wouldn't have eaten here.  It was in a strip mall, and really not appealing from the outside.  There was a glow of the red light reading Valle Luna, and neon writing on the glass windows advertisiting the specials and NFL ticket (it's not football season).    Anyway, we had good service and the food was great.  Pros: I loved the chips, salsa, and black bean/refried bean dip they gave us for an app.    The portions were HUGE!  I suggest splitting or come prepared to take home.    Outdoor seating  Neat canopy like booths and tables inside, transporting you to another place  $20 off $60 coupon  Fajitas were able to come with two different meats for no additional charge  All food was really hot (temp wise).  Cons: One of the frozen margaritas came out not blended.  The fruit was on the bottom, still whole, and the ice and booze was taking up the top of the glass.  Our waitress, Jenni, had no problem bringing a beer in place of the unsatisfactory drink.
Best Mex around. Good variety on menu, fokd well prepared. Service quick and friendly. Prices fare. Di it.

We thought we tried out Valle Luna restaurant because we had buy one get one free entree  Worth trip!  The food is excellent, great service unfortunately the air in  part of the restaurant was out but I would definitely come again.

Great local spot for some happy hour and food to keep you functioning enough to keep throwing back brews. They have this awesome drink called the dogma which isn't for the faint of heart that sets the tone every time I stop by that I always introduce to newcomers. The bar staff is always friendly and quick and the chips and salsa always on point.

We have been going to this restaurant for a lot of years. Always had great service and great food. Till tonite I got some bad pork on my tacos, told the server she said she would get new tacos... well all said and done. Had to send chips back -- detail, never got a refill on my tea.. when she finally gave me the check I was charged more for my dinner. She said she would send the mgr to our table never came... so bottom line he took2.00 of the bill-- no apology they just lost a good customer-- they just didn't seem to give a rats butt!!!!!!!!

Got there on "Taco Tuesday" around 6pm and wow was it packed!  We went to the bar area and was able to grab a table top.  Our server was right on the ball with getting us waters and menus.  He made sure we got the chips and salsa to tie us over as the place was packed!! 2nd mention.  We got our order in right away and only had to wait about 20 minutes to get our food.  We didnt order off the happy hour menu but there was plenty to choose from.  My order wasnt correct when I got it but were in a time crunch so didnt want to wait to send it back.  I ordered a combo plate with all chicken and ended up with ground beef :(  Taco fell apart, enchilada was all cheese and the tamale was the worst I had ever tasted.  My daughters ground beef enchiladas were less than par also.  Definately not the quality of food we were hoping for.  Unfortunately cant rate it very highly.  Maybe if we went during a non-happy hour time would have been a different experience however I'll go with my instinct to not go back to try again.   Great service, just poor food.

This place is one of our favorite. We are usually there once if not twice per week. But the last 4 times, their service has been horrible. Today we were there for 3 hrs. It took the server forever to come and take our order. We had to call him to get a drink and to get refill on our salsa and chips. We could have had another drink, but the server never came after he dropped our food at the table. We had to get the managers attention to explain what was going on, and all she did, was bring our check. We pay our bill and left. Food is AMAZING, service could use ALOT of improvement. P.S. if your memory is not that great while taking our order, use a notebook to take our order down and actually bring out what we order. Definitely going back for the food and drink. Just hopefully we don't get the same server. And hopefully this review, helps the manager of the place as a feedback of what needs to change if they want to capture customers. Because if we choose to spend our money there, we deserve some attention. We could easily go down the street and give our money to another restaurant.

AMAZING happy hour specials. We can get 2 pitchers of beer and eat all the food we want for about $20 on a Saturday afternoon. How can you beat that!? The food is simple and good, the staff is fast and friendly, and the patio is delightful.

The portion sizes are good and it was averagely priced. But the service was honestly really slow. Our waiter couldn't handle our big top, which would be intimidating, but the manager should have kept her in training longer. It's a really pretty restaurant though and the food is average.

I have been to Valle Luna many times, but today was exceptional! We phoned in a take out order to Brandon, and he got everything right! He was very polite on the phone, read back our order, then offered to meet me at the curb, because parking can be a bear. When I arrived at the restaurant, Brandon was there to greet me, he processed my payment and got the order from the kitchen. He then offered to walk it out to my car. I appreciate good service when I receive it, thank you Brandon!

I had the pollo fundido here, it was pretty good.  I think you would like this place if you are someone who's not afraid of cheese and a little grease to go with that.  Its Sonoran style so U should know that there is gonna be a bit of cheese thrown in.  As for the grease, it comes from all the frying : )    They have pretty decent salsa and chips, but I guess the bean dip does not come standard any more because I did not see them serve that with the chips.  Maybe you got to ask for it.  Food alone should give this place 4-5 stars but the service was a little underpar.  Its not that bad, but certainly was just sufficient without any attempts to improve.  The host was in the midst of seating me but stopped to address an issue with the kitchen on a phone order.  I guess its not a big deal as the bus boys were really fast and would bring u, the salsa and chips and greet u warmly.    As for my server, well I guess she would be a 7/10 service-wise.  Passable but not exceeding anything.  She was in a hurry to put her order in and I noticed her doing the same thing to other customers too.  When the table next to me asked what kind of meat was in their chilli rellenos, she just replied, there is no meat in the chilli rellenos, without any explanation of what it was and if there is an alternative.  The customer got convinced into ordering a pollo fundido which according to the waitress was the same as a chilli rellenos but with a chicken (not really !).    In her defense, she was not rude or uncaring, just very order-oriented and focused on fulfilling them.  She would go around and ask if everything was okay with her charges and did ask if I needed a refill on my ice teas.  I guess its better than a server who would not come around at all, that would be worse.  So perhaps you would want to view the menu online first, using the link on this page and then read about what they were, so you can ask "educated" questions about the foods or know right up front what you want, so they can bring you something nice and hot to eat real fast :)  I would come back again if I am craving a nice cheesy (in a good way) meal.  Also the view is pretty good, its overlooking a little lake that it shares a view with Coffee Rush.
They stay busy.  It is nice if you can sit outside on the water.  The service is fast and efficient and the prices are great.  I really enjoy the cocktails and the charro beans.  Mmmmm...

Their $5 margaritas are always the perfect start to any night out!   Service and cleanliness definitely leaves room for improvement. The bartender we has wasn't very friendly and engaging, and the surrounding tables were filled with crumbs from the chips and salsa. So this isn't exactly where I would spend a good portion of my night, but staying for one or two drinks was fine.
Great local place that I don't go to enough.  The food is really good and they have great specials almost everyday.

2 things that do not go well together: 1) mexican food 2) high prices. With hundreds of Mexican restaurants to choose from, we were lured in with a coupon and Wednesday "family" night.  Sure kid gets 4 corn dogs the size of your thumb for $1.50 and the wife and I split a $13 chimichanga + $2 upcharge for splitting (we were stuffed from the bottomless chip and salsa bowl)  now i gotta throw down a few prunes just to keep the pipes clean (and smooth, if you get my drift)  fool me once.....  on a side note, the whole Anderson Springs shopping center is packed to the gills on a wednesday night.  amazing

I love Valle Luna. Great Food. Great Service.   I came here for my anniversary a couple of weeks ago, and I was blown away by the quality of the service and the food that were provided.   I'm a big fan of the chimichangas, so if you have a chance to grab one, I recommend the chicken chimichanga. They are phenomenal.

Perfect place for date night!  We received a coupon in the mail, buy 1 entree get 1 free up to $11. It's a little far from our house but we decided to give it a shot.  We were very pleased.  It was a Wednesday night, which is Family Night. It was very busy but we were sat immediately because we wanted to sit outside on the patio.  The patio is PRETTY AWESOME! It looks out onto a precious, good sized pond which makes for a tranquil setting.  To make the experience even better there are ducks waddling around making you smile.  Service was a tiny bit slow but they were busy and I've been a server before so I know what's up!  Our server was awesome! He was sweet, informative,  positive and laid back.  We didn't mind at all about the lax and longer wait times because the atmosphere rocked and we were having a great time.  The food was great! We had the trio dips for an appitizer. The guacamole,  chorizo con queso and the cream cheese jalape√±o.  The Cream Cheese Jalape√±o is delicious as well as the guacamole.  I wasn't a huge fan of the Chorizo Con Queso but I had never had that kind of dip before. My man said it wasn't the best he'd ever had but still good. We had the chicken and steak fajitas and the fundido!  Both delicious! The Fundido was definitely worth it!  I also had a Cadillac Margarita.  It's tradition for me to get a Margarita on the rocks with salt and a shot on the side due to the margaritas not being strong enough. I want to taste the tequila and I'm a Lil bit of an alchy.  Anyway....I got a Margarita with 1800 Silver and a Grand Marnier floater with a shot of 1800 on the side.  The Margarita was so strong that I didn't even need the extra shot! Impressive!  We love the place! Definitely worth the drive and we will be back soon!

I am opening a day spa practically right next to this place so after hours of meeting contractors, taking measurements, etc. in our currently empty space my wife and I were ready for a margarita and some good food. So we decided to try one of new neighbors and I have to say that we were very impressed.   The inside is beautiful with wood beams and little false roofs that make the atmosphere cozy. Of course, the lake is right there which also adds to the atmosphere. Margaritas were $5 on Mondays, which we were happy about because that was number on our list that day. The menu had lots of great choices but we decided to just order two appetizers. We got a mixed mini taco plate and sliders.  Both of our choices were first rate, not greasy, and were served quickly. We thought the service was exceptional. A manager was walking around checking everything the entire time and was actually the one that asked if we wanted a second drink. I always like it when managers are hands on with customers.  My only negative is that one item we ordered was more expensive than we thought. The menu we looked at was for the cantina only, not the main restaurant. Apparently, the cantina has its own specials. I thought that was confusing for a new customer but I don't think they were trying to be misleading at all so I would not knock their rating for that. It was really our fault.  I noticed most of the negative reviews here are old. I thought it was excellent so maybe they changed.

LOVE, LOVE, LOVE THIS PLACE!!!    They have Buy one get one free coupons in the monthly coupon mailer book and Wednesdays are Family night which have their own specials.  Their Happy hour goes until 7:30pm which is the longest Happy hour around. Also they have daily specials for margaritas and specialty drinks(prickly pear marg is the bomb). $2.75 pints and $8 pitcher of domestic beer on HH too.  This is going to sound strange but they have the BEST GRILLED WINGS!! I would have never thought to try them, but we smelled some as they went by and had to order a dozen. They were SO tasty and flavroful! And from a Mexican place?  We haven't tried the burgers but we heard from other people that they were good too.  The Pork Verde is super DELICIOUS, and HUGE!  I really haven't had anything bad from Luna either. We are here often and each time we always see a new magic trick from Chewy - the awesomest bartender!  The service is quick and when something comes out wrong, they quickly remake the item and it's out without 5 minutes.    The patio has the best view of the lake too since it's in the center. They have tons of TVs, fenced the ducks off the patio, misters, both pubs and tables. It really can't get much better.  I mean, maybe if they had recliners or something but for now I'm all positive and give Valle and big thumbs up!

What happened? What happened to this east valley landmark? I think it's gone downhill. Four of us sat at a table and none of us were impressed by anything.  I had the most bland fajita's ever. I could feel a cold coming on so I asked for jalepeno's or habenero's or anything to spice it up.......I got nothing.  Servers were attentive and dessert was good, but I can't say anything positive about the main courses. I doubt I will make it back.
Best happy hour!! Weekdays until 7:30. Sit on the patio with a couple margaritas and some mini bean burros without spending $10.

The patio area is perfect.  It sits on the neighborhood lake and it's just beautiful and relaxing.  The patio is large and separates the bar area and dining area.  The food was delicious also.  One person had a bean burrito which was huge and very delicious.  Another had the border tacos, which were very flavorful.  I had the tomato, onion and chili cheese crisp.  It was the size of a pizza and incredibly delicious.  All in all  great meals in a wonderful setting.

Quality Mexican food at a great price! I'd recommend sitting in the cantina area or on the patio for the best atmosphere. The bar backs up to a lake with the cutest little ducks wondering around! As with most Mexican joints, the free chips and salsa are a bonus. They have super cheap happy hour prices and often have buy one get on free entr√©e coupons in the mail. Never had an issue with service, but parking can be a bit of a nightmare.

We used to live down the street from the N. Phoenix restaurant and were regulars at the cantina. This place has an even better cantina and their outdoor section overlooks a man-made lake! Their food is pretty good, though we mainly just eat cheese crisps and grilled chicken wings. And their happy hour is awesome, having great specials and cheap beer.  We'll definitely be headed back to catch a game or just chill on the patio.

The chips, salsa and bean dip are the good reasons to go here.... other than that not much to say.  Everything seems to be sooo greasy and mushy within seconds.  If you order something with a crispy taco, eat that first!  It will be a soggy mess soon.  I have to say that they have a nice patio or drinks which has been a better experience than the food and I wish it wasn't so because I live really close by.  I do have to say that the service is always 5 star.

I crave Mexican food all the time and this establishment will not disappoint. I usually get the Chimi and its delicious and comes with chips and salsa that are also fresh. The take out staff is top notch! Highly Recommended. Wish they would send me more coupons like in the past.
Good location, nice staff, the food is typical AZ Mex, drinks are a little watered down for my taste.
Best happy hour in town, the $5.50 taco basket is delicious! The back patio is a great spot to meet friends and grab a drink.
Good food, Service was not the best. Slow and not very good interaction but not rude. Good drink specials.

Visited today after the hubby went with his co workers for lunch. I have to say, I'm impressed. Service was great, the food was excellent, happy hour specials are every day and even my son finished his food. When we were leaving, we saw one of my husband's co worker's who is particularly picky when it comes to Mexican food...so he def must've approved because he came back with his wife!  We'll def be back again.

I loved this place.I usually judge mexican on the staples :rice, chips & salsa and drinks. All of the above rocked. Not only that, but they serve spicy beans to dip your chips in. DELISH! We were seated promptly and with a smile! The waitress was also attentive (making sure our glasses were full) yet not overbearing!   I had the tacos i could barely finish one but thats because I ate EVERYTHING! :)  A great place for a nice hot meal and a place to converse with your company.
I love their salsa I love their pollo fundido And this is my favorite Valle Luna location of them all... thanks to the lake :)  Love it!
Happy hour is well worth it.   The service was good , my waiter kinda got lost in the crowd ( maybe he can crowd surf).

Came here for lunch and some cocktails after a long hike with a friend. Was hoping for some Taco Tuesday specials but they had none. Actually they only had tacos as an appetizer and they were lackluster. We tried a dip trio and a chimichanga which were both good and filling. I also couldn't get enough of their complimentary salsa which was really good. Our server, Christian was very nice.   The only gripe I have with this place is the drinks. I had to send back a drink because i could barely stomach it. I don't know if the bartender is pouring half a bottle of bad tequila into those margaritas or their lime juice is off but it was just terrible. We tried multiple drinks and all were awful except for a frozen sangria margarita which was ok.
