I definitely won't be coming back for the drinks but overall he food and service were good and they had a lot of nice patio space. Shame, I live around the corner and this would have been a perfect spot for cocktails and a safe walk home.
Sunday's are awesome here. Great prices, good quality bar food. Sitting on the patio is heaven!
$30 for two plates of hot mush. My wife and I had belly aches the rest of the day. Never again.
Food is good . Service is hit or miss.  Prices have gone up in recent years but quality has not.
Food was excellent! They lost our order so it took over a hour to get our food...service was alright

The food is good but not amazing. Decent sized portions to where, as usual, I eat half and have a full meal for the next day. I would not say I loved the food though. The service was pretty decent, nothing extraordinary. The prices are very good though. My husband and I spend $25 with tip on 2 meals. I have seen all kinds of coupons floating around in those little clippers as well, so keep an eye out! Buy one get one free. This is more of the kind of place where you are hungry but not starving and craving Mexican. They are close so we will be going again, but I wouldn't drive more than 10 minutes to get here.

We have come here many times before and these guys are usually very good but they missed the mark tonight. In their defense, they were VERY busy but...... We had to ask for drink refills several times and the food order came separately and very slowly. The restaurant was clean and had a nice atmosphere. Staff was friendly. Food was "OK" compared to previous visits which I would describe as "very good". We will come back, but not soon.

The food here is always spectacular but last night my family and I went for dinner and the corner we sat in had this awful stench I felt like we were in the dungeon and our server his  name was Esteban he didn't care at all didnt care if we had refills forgot about us pretty much the whole time usually when you sit in the bar or outside service is good

Valle Luna is a reasonably reliable Mexican restaurant.  Nothing spectacular, but reliable.  The food is pretty good, the menu has a good variety of "classics" (burros, chimis, fundido, etc), the chips and salsa are fine.  Nothing spectacular.   Service is reasonable, and the prices aren't bad (especially if you get a coupon which shows up sometimes in those coupon clipper magazines).  Obviously I'm not raving about this place.  I would put it on par with Garcia's or Serrano's.  Not great, but not bad.  Nowhere near the level of someplace like La Tolteca.  But it was closer, I have limited time for lunch, and I had a coupon.  One thing I will say is they support youth athletic programs.  They have numerous plaques displayed of the various teams they have supported.  Girls' soccer, boys' baseball, etc.  A LOT of plaques.  It's cool that Valle Luna takes an interest in their community like that.  Many places don't.  Has nothing to do with the quality of the food, but when choosing between comparable restaurants like Garcia's and Serrano's, I think it is nice to know I am helping support such things with my patronage of the restaurant.

Drinking water cause they got the pepsi.  Food came out uncooked,  slow service. Server tried to tell me thats how it is.  really you serve mexican food with cheese that isn't melted?  No visit from a manager or anything. this is a place in need of a visit from restaurant impossible.  I won't be going back.
still the best place to eat Mexican food. kids can play by the lake and the happy hour deals are perfect for our budget.

The best Mexican food that money can buy. I especially like the machaca beef burrito with rice and black beans.  The green chili burrito is excellent too.  The service is excellent as well as the salsa and chips.
Good chimichangas. Lunch specials are well worth it. Table salsa and chips are great.

We come here often. No complaints, really. However today our cheese crisp lacked the crisp- completely undercooked. After one piece I was done. My husband went ahead and ate the rest. Thankfully in doing so since his wings he ordered were dry and overcooked. Luckily we have dogs at home waiting for them. Service is fine not exceptional. Drinks- we recommend the prickly pear margarita.

What do you come here for?  Fantastic frozen margaritas and the patio on the lake.  Other than that, the food is fine and the service lacks.    We hit this place up on a Sunday night about 6p.  We had to wait about 10m and then were seated at booth inside with a view of the lake.  Our server was MIA for a long time and then all of a sudden she almost popped around the side of the booth and asked for drink orders (She never really stopped and stood and talked to us, just popped in and out). At some point a basket of chips with salsa and bean dip came out, which was great because it took FOREVER to get food - we ate every chip!   I had the chile relleno, black beans and rice.  It all tasted fine, but it had no spice, good flavor just no heat.  Oh and another thing about heat, it must have sat back there awhile before the waitress could get to it because it was warm-ish.  So it was all fine.  Not bad, not great. A-OK seems about right.    The only thing I can rave about was the frozen margs. They were a perfect amount of slush and booze!  I would have had more if I my waitress gave us more than a couple pop ins!  Oh well, give it try, may you will like it!

My most disappointing meal at Valle Luna. We have gone to the Chandler location for years but today our service was very poor at best. Our waiter, who I can't name because he said the name on the tag was not his, did not  provide good service. The booth next to us was seated 10 minutes after us but was served their meals before my wife and I received our order. I had to get up and get my own "to go" box because he never returned. Finally got or bill, paid cash, and got out. There are so many restaurants in the area there is no reason to return to one that does not provide good service.

My family came here on Oct 30th with my father who drove across the country to visit. They were not busy, there were only a few tables seated throughout the restaurant. We were seated outside, chips and salsa were brought promptly. We sat there for 25 minutes waiting for service. A server named Will noticed about 10 minutes in and promised to find our server for us. Another 10 minutes passed and I went to let the hostesses know that we hadn't even been greeted yet. At the 25 minute mark a table was seated next to us and were immediately greeted by Cassie, who I can only assume was our server since she was waiting on every seated table around us. She made eye contact with members of my family several times but never acknowledged us. At this point we decided to leave and stood up. Again, Will noticed and began profusely apologizing. He talked us into staying, immediately brought drinks, took our orders, and discounted everything. He is the only reason Valle Luna has any of our money, and they won't be getting anymore of it. The food is underwhelming, and aside from Will, the service is terrible.

I recently held a banquet here for my mother's 50th birthday. It was recommended that I use Valle Luna because they are easy to work with. I made a couple visits to the restaurant before booking the banquet. What had me sold was their beautiful view from their back patio. I was able to set up the menu for the banquet. They answered all of my questions. What really had me sold was on the day of the banquet I had an excellent server called Ricky. I can tell Ricky is a pro. He made sure to ask me all the questions he needed to help me make the party run smoother. There was a very small mix up with a menu item we ordered and he resolved it very quickly. Ricky really made the party. I was able to focus on the guest of honor and other party guests. The service was good and the food was excellent. Everything tasted good and there was enough food for everyone. They were even able to accommodation a last minute desert order. I will consider using Valle Luna again for a banquet!

The food was so gross!!!!! We sent our margaritas back, and left the majority of our food. I feel sick thinking about it. I can say our service was great! Very friendly and attentive hostess and waiter. Will not go back to this place and would not recommend eating here.
Not bad food, but the frozen margaritas are really good.  It may have just been what I ordered (shredded beef tacos) but they could back of on the salt!   All in all, I will go again.
This is not going to blow your sox off... but they food is consistent, good variety, and decent quality.  I like their green chili best. Pretty much all I get there now when I go.
The fish tacos and pollo Fundito were awesome.  The view  from our seat looking over the lake was great. The fried ice cream was awesome.

I wouldn't typically to go that kind of restaurant for a mexican food ( I look for hole-in-the-wall type of mexican restaurants), but because I was with a big family who was craving for a mexican dish, I found this place in my area (Southeast Valley). My grannies were thrilled to see the 2 for 1 deal for senior citizens-the place was flooded with happy 'n' stomach-crammed senior citizens-we were waiting for them to leave and tables to clear up. I can understand some of the bad reviews, but the restaurant has been there forever, since I was born, and it's good enough for a big group who aren't very picky about Mexican food. A neutral place in hope to satisfy everyone in the group as there are alot of selections on the menu. I was lucky to have had an amazing vegetarian tamale called "Tamale Dinner" (with green chili corns), and apparently, it's one of their specials. I finished the whole plate-the rice and beans were delicious, and I was surprised to leave without an upset stomach (mexican food=be ready for a screwed up digestion function). I wish we sat outside as there is a nice terrace with a man-made lake view.

I used to go here years ago and the food with happy hour was free and delicious! I went there today and my chimichanga was ready in just a few minutes. Fast service, nice staff. about 25 bucks for 2 people to eat. I like this place

I love Valle Luna! I only give 4 stars because they don't blow me away good. We have so many mexican restarants in the valley to choose from  but what does impress me is that every time I have gone, the food is consistently good.Good chips and salsa which is very important. I love the margaritas there because they are never watered down tasting in fact, they tend to be a little heavy on the liquor which is a good thing but know that  before you plan to drive. I personally don't drink if I am so I always go there and make my husband drive ;-) It is a great place to meet people for food and drinks because they never rush you and it is very relaxed and friendly there. I for one will keep going

First, I feel bad about this.  I love Valle Luna and have been a regular customer for years now.  Good food, great ambience, and generally good service.  Not tonight.  We settled in the lounge to take advantage happy hour drinks with a plan for a nice long evening ending in a full dinner and desert.  It was a hot day in Phoenix, and even hotter inside the lounge.  In the end I was literally about to pass out and had to leave mid meal to go to the car to cool down. We mentioned the heat to the waitress who, much like her services (I won't go into that, but not good), dismissed us saying it was hot for her too.  Frankly it was inexcusable to have the establishment even opened,  and a waste of patron money ordering food that they are unable to eat.  I would have preferred they had closed the doors until they could get their air fixed.
I love their mexican pizza!  Happy hour in the cantina has great deals, half off appetizers and drink specials.

Mondays are $0.99 margaritas, cant get a better Happy Hour price than that. I am apart of a local Chandler meet and greet group and we have discovered this great special and plan to be back every Monday while we support local Chandler businesses.  We sat on the patio next to the beautiful lake, so relaxing and peaceful.  The patio is large and has multiple TV's for everyone.  Our server was awesome, with our large group if 20+ people she was attentive, sharp, friendly and provided awesome service.  Haven't been to Valle Luna in many many years, but it was just as awesome as I remember.

Well my family and I have been customers for 10+ years now and I have to say Valle Luna just ain't what it use to be. We hosted our wedding rehearsal dinner here 8 years ago and this is a "must go to" restaurant for our out of town guests. However its just not as good as it use to be. The food isn't as good, the service is definitely not as good either. We come back because my husband craves the taco basket on the regular and the chips and salsa are pretty tasty, they also have good specials throughout the week. I wish they would bring back some old recipes (seafood enchiladas) and update their decor, mainly the tables. Also, get a more friendly and professional host/hostess staff. If you are a fish taco lover, don't get them here... they are the most boring fish tacos I have ever eaten and they are not cheap. Just my personal opinions.

Great food on the patio. The margarita special is fun even though they are super sweet. We usually bring a coupon when we can get them because it usually saves at least $5 or more. It's perfect to hit this place up for lunch and then go a few doors down for amazing ice cream.

Took family for Happy Hour last night and had the best service from Brittany.   She took all of our food and drink orders without writing anything down and everything came out perfect.  Thanks Brittany!

The location is nice, the service was good, but in my opinion, the food has gone so far downhill I hope never to return. It's not that the food is gross or anything like that, it seems fresh but the flavor is just so blah. My parents and grandparents love it but if you like spicy, flavorful Mexican food this place isn't for you.

bland bland bland!  If you like Mexican food with no taste then this is the place to go.  The salsa tasted like tomato sauce, the bean dip had no flavor, and I don't think I've ever had a more tasteless chile relleno in my life.  Not even the pepper had any taste.  The whole plate was covered in cheese and mediocre rice and beans.  I did like the small side of guacamole, the only thing I liked at the table.  The service was lackluster and seemed to match up with the food here.    What I did like was that it sits right on a small lake and I would imagine in nicer weather it would be fun to drink margaritas and sit by the water.

My friend and I went for lunch today, as it is close to both our offices. We had never been there, and for good reason after going. The place has an 80's decor, that's the good part. The oil they fry their chips in must be very old because every chip I ate tasted like I was just eating a chunk of lard, literally disgusting. The salsa & bean dip was the best part. I had a beef taco that completely fell apart, and the rice & beans were mush. My friend had the pollo fundido w/unmelted cheese. With in the hour after we left the place, we both got sick w/the runs ( think it was the lard tasting chips).  I came back to work, and my coworker said he went last week , his girlfriend got the pollo fundido burrito (same as my friend), and she literally got food poisoning, hurled7 times ! Wish I would have known before going there! It's expensive too, so not worth it. Not Recommended whatsoever! Some Burros is 100 times tastier & it's fast food!

Love that Valle Luna sits right on the lake, I enjoy feeding the duckies chips (even though I'm not supposed to) and sitting outside. The food is good, not great, but good. The bean dip is also pretty good, but not as good as serranos. We come here once in a while, but not a place I'd go out of my way for. Like I said, good, but not great.

This place offers consistently good Mexican Food. However, it is kind of hard to compete in Phoenix. The chips, salsa and bean dip was very good. Chips were served hot to our table. Sadly they were out of salsa verde which is totally my favorite part. I ordered the Port Verde which comes with rice and beans. The sides were spot on but the Pork Verde was a bit bland. My friend ordered a combo plate with a tostada, enchilada and crispy taco. Unfortunately, his instructions had been forgotten and the tostada and taco had ingredients on it that he couldn't eat. Portion sizes are good and the server was pretty attentive.
Great ambiance. Been taking the family for a decade but needs allergy friendly menu items. It's funky decor is fun. I haven't been to happy hour which I hear is fun. Regular hours are family friendly

I know people who really love this place, so maybe I have visited on a bad day(s) or I am just extra-picky when it comes to my Mexican food. IMO, Valle Luna is just average. Although I admit the service has been good and the ambiance is nice.   On our last visit, we were immediately greeted by a cheerful hostess and taken to a booth along the far side of the wall. Unfortunately the patio was full. If you get a choice, ask for a table outside overlooking the water. It helps the so-so food go down better.   Pros: Big portions, lots of cheese, good service.   Cons: Ho-hum food. Lots of grease. Can be too crowded.

I absolutely LOVE this restaurant!  Their food is great with huge portions and LOW prices!  We delayed heading back to TX (where we have MANY) wonderful Mexican restaurants) just so we go eat lunch before leaving!!  Can't wait to come back to the Phoenix area so we can eat here again! Tuesdays they have a BOGO for seniors, in case you are interested. (3-10PM)

Great for lunch. Great for dinner, great for happy hour, great for Sunday morning breakfast on bar patio.  I love this happy place with friendly staff, great food, relaxed atmosphere.  The restaurant has inside and outside dining as does the bar. Nice view of Lakeshore Condo lake and fountain.

This is really great Mexican food. I have gone there twice now and each time the food has been amazing. The frozen margarita's are also wonderful. The chips and salsa you get on the table are a nice added bonus as well.

Great food! Great specials. We are regulars and we love the staff however on a beautiful day you can't enjoy the patio because of all the smokers. So if you're allergic to smoke this is definitely not the place to go on a beautiful day outside. The only thing we would change is the smoking policy.
Valle is all about the ritas happy hour, chips and bean dip and an awesome patio, if you are looking to eat awesome pollo funditos well they have that too...

So its Thursday night and I got a certificate from Resturant.com for Valle Luna and thought I haven't been out with the kids in a while wonder if they are up to trying a new place, and guess what, they were, ok when I say kids, I really mean 21, 19, & 16 yr old, yea they are not really kids, but they are my kids :)  It was my 1st time there and I really wanted to like Valle Luna, it's just right up the street from me. I did some research and read some reviews of friends and thought ok, this is going to be a good place!  When we 1st got there they put us in a small booth, we were sitting on top on each other, the 21 yr old is 6 months prego and they placed us in table where it was very tight and making her uncomfortable and I had my left handed son sitting next to me elbowing me already and the food hadn't even arrived yet (s/n: I really think he sits by me to bug the crap out of me) so we asked for a bigger table and we got moved almost into a small booth on the other side, my daughter said yea that's not going to work, that's what the other one was and it hurt to sit there, so we were moved to a table with the view of the lake, it was nice, felt like was in a different area then just chillin in chandler   It was happy hour when I arrived and it was Three-O Thursday, all Three Olive Vodka drinks for 3 bucks, so I ordered the Cherry Smash, it was a pretty drink, but way too strong for me , I know I was even shocked I couldn't finish it!   The chips, bean dip & salsa arrived to the table, now to me the chips were not that bad, tasted ok, some of the reviews said it was the worst part of it, to me they were ok, the salsa on the other hand reminded me of pace picante, one was sweet and the other was just like tomato sauce, packed no heat what so ever, but the kids liked it and ate it.  Ok I'll just tell you what they ordered real quickly:  21yr old ordered the Tamale Dinner, she loves tamales, she thought the flavor was good, tamale itself was a little dry, but it cured her caving.  19 yr old ordered grilled asada burro dinner, she loved it! This plate looks like something I should have ordered, she loved it!  16 yr old ordered southwestern chicken breast, he didn't care for it, he said the chicken tasted like I cooked it, meaning it looked great, but was dry, sometimes I just wanna smack him haha  After reading everyone's reviews, I was really looking forward to what I ordered, I ordered the Fundido, I understood that it was deep fried, but mine looked and tasted like it was left in the fryer for way too long, the tortilla was inedible, I scraped everything out of it and left the shell on another plate.   The beans & rice were good, and so what the filling inside the tortilla, the jalapeno-cream cheese could have had more heat for, but was very good. I don't think I will be ordering this dish again.  We were having a good time talking with each other and decided that we wanted desert, so 2 of us ordered the fried ice cream and one ordered the chocolate taco. I was one of the ones who ordered the fried ice cream and I chose caramel for topping instead of chocolate, and I asked if it could be drowned in caramel and it was ,,omg it was soo delish!!!!!   I do want to come back to Valle Luna to give them another try, the kids did enjoy themselves and the food, so they are willing to go back with me.
Good service and great food.  We always have a great experience going.  Never any issues. We always get coupons from there in the mail for buy one get one and they always honor them.

Came to lunch with on my coworkers that I have not seen in a long time.  We sat in the patio due to nice sweet weather.  The patio tables and chairs are a little dirty.  Service was super slow.  Had to get the server's attention a few times for refills.  The food was ok and little bland.  =(

Ok service, waitress was nice. But she didn't  seem to care once we told here that the food we ordered was dry and was unsatisfactory. All she said was, yeah nothing compares to home made. We ordered the tamales they were dry and had almost no meat in them. Our waitress said they wouldn't be dry if we put the sauce on top. But if your cook could make tamales correctly we shouldn't need sauce to make them moist. The best part of our meal was the rice. We spent 40 for a plate of nasty tamales and good rice. We will never be back. If your smart you will not come here any hole in the wall Mexican restaurant is better than this dump. Too bad really we live close and could have been regular customers.

We had come on a Sunday night and for some bizarre reason a birthday was being held in the bar area.  So with that being said it was impossible to get around to go to the bathroom directly unless you went the long way and then when it came to our food and drinks the older lady that was our server took forever to come over to bring us our food and drinks regardless if it was a soda or water.  Whenever i go to restaurants and am thirsty the servers wont be there to ask if you would like a refill or not. but the days i am not thirsty they are there non stop which is great.  Bad luck maybe.  The chicken tacos were disgusting. The fish tacos apparently were okay. So next time i suppose I should try that instead of the chicken tacos.
Been coming here for over 20 years. It's the only restaurant we regularly visit. Service is always great and the food is amazing. Pollo funditto for life!

We have eaten here many times before but this time we ordered the taco baskets.  My wife bit into one of the tacos and bit into a 3" wood stick. She called and spoke to the Manager to explained what happened and all the Manager could say is that they use them to cook the meat and they should have taken it out. She didn't even offer to comp the meal. Be careful and check your tacos before you bite into them because you could choke or lose a tooth. See attached photo of stick.

My daughter and I got there at 8:15 on Friday. We were seated close to the doors to the patio. Restaurant is 60% empty, so I figured we would have great service. Young man came over and gave us the chips and salsa. Then a girl comes over with a high ponytail, says I'm leaving for the night, Gabe will take care of you. She took our drink orders, brought us our drinks moved on to service her tables. About 15 mins later Gabe showed up. I ordered the #2, enchilada/taco rice and beans. I asked if the macacha was really hot. He said, "It has habaneros in it." With sarcasm... I said I wanted green chili chicken enchilada and green chili taco. Oh you can't have green chili on a taco. I said ok, green chili chicken on the enchilada and shredded chicken taco. He repeated me. The busser brought our meals out, gave my plate to my daughter and vice versa (she also ordered a 2 but different meat). We traded and I started digging into the enchilada. It was not chicken, but some pork or beef. I could not eat it. Gabe never came by and I said this is not chicken. Our green chili is pork. I said I asked for chicken. He said, you said green chili. No offer to make it right. No apology for the misunderstanding. I could not eat it. The meat looked gray.  15 mins later, he came by with new drinks and our check. Didn't ask if we wanted dessert. If we wanted anything more. For that, he got 3 bucks on a $35 bill. I will NEVER be back! I loved this place when it was in Ahwatukee. No more! I'll go to Si Senor first!

One of my favorite places. Great staff, great food, the patio view is a jewel, and it's a awesome place to watch a game. Some of my favorites are the Shrimp Chimichanga, Mini Taco Basket, the Fundido and believe it or not, some of the best chicken wings you can get. Order them grilled after fried, so good. Always good times!
I haven't eaten at many Mexican cuisine restaurants, but this one is by far the best I have had yet.  Great food & descent service.  I have no complaints.
They have a pretty good lunch menu, I generally like the Caesar wrap. Do not go unless you have time because service is pretty slow.

Darcie and I dropped by around noon on a Sunday, or what Valle Luna calls Sunday Funday... and it was. We are def going back, and we are excited about it. {Tacos}  Funday happens in the Bar area. Brace for flavor impact: you are entering the awesomely affordable and incredibly delicious zone. Awesome Tomas, the bartender, was welcoming & friendly, knowledgeable and efficient. It's been a week and my mind is still dwelling on.. the tacos. Dude slings cold beer, wine, and eye-openningly tasty salsa and food. {Tacos, tacos}  Call me simple (you wouldn't be the first), but if your Mexican joint has subpar Taco- or Salsa-game... it's a hard pass for me. Fortunately, that's no concern here. {Tacos}  Valle Luna has stellar tacos and salsa. Grab a telescope. Point it to the Heavens and on a clear night you will see them up there. Alternately, just drop by Valle Lune and behold the bounty. Even their mini tacos are substantial. The regular salsa is very tasty, and their hot salsa has a memorably flavorful zing. Holy moley I'm in love with this place. {Tacos... em-effin tacos}  We also got the Bandito Burritos (mini bean burros, deep fried) and a cheese crisp. They were OK. The cheese crisp was more chewy than crisp and I could have done without the deep frying of the little burros. But I was on such a stratospheric high from the A-M-A-Z-I-N-G TACOS that my review is getting all wrapped up in 5-STARS for me. {Oh, the Tacos}  Throughout this review I have liberally strewn a consistent subliminal message that should prep you for your Valle Luna culinary adventure. {T-A-C-O-S}  I envy you the fresh discovery. {haunting whisper... tacos}  Big Thanks to Jesse for getting me Tomas' name. Credit where credit is due baby!

Been going to Valle Luna literally for years. Good service good food good happy hour.  Tonight was a beautiful AZ night to enjoy happy hour on the patio.  Except the patio was literally full and more then half the guests enjoying the weather were smoking! Aren't there laws about how far away you can smoke? We sat at the table closest to the door! I smelled like smoke when I left as if I was in a smokey bar! GROSS!
Excellent ambiance. Service is nice to look at but not exactly proficient. Love the lake view

This was our favorite neighborhood spot.   Was. The last two times our service has been so terrible it is unbearable. Over thirty minutes to have our order taken. Longer for drinks to be delivered. And a very annoyed condescending server when we asked questions.   There are many places nearby that would be better. We will not be back. So sad to see this place slide into decline.

Had a party for 9 today at lunch. Took 40 mins for our food to arrive. We advised our waiter Harry ahead of time that we were on a work lunch break and if we could get our check with our food. Asked for Togo boxes with our food those never came had to go get them. Our checks were not ready had to wait on. My taco of whole bean rice and lettuce was wrong sent back then still wrong. And for one taco it apparently cost $4.27. When I wanted to changed my form of payment from a card to cash I was snapped at by Harry for messing up his order there were 3 cards there including mine. At no point were we ever apologized too for the late food. A sorry about that would have gone along way. The other girls said the food was good but would never go when your in a hurry.  We were at lunch for a special occasion and it was dampened by the poor services we received!

One of my favorite local Mexican food joints. Located a couple miles from home I've come here a few times. Nice atmosphere and the food is quality.   Window seats have a nice view of the lake behind and the style of decor within the restaurant is fitting.   Highly recommend the restaurant.

Though the service was slow at the beginning, the place was crowded and had to wait 15 minutes.  Ordered the carna asada steak and my friend ordered the shredded beef chimi, both were really good.  The plates didn't look sloppy but appetizing.  The salsa and chips were also good, they add some herbs to their thick salsa which is pleasant.  Didn't order drinks but they seemed very reasonable.  Rita's for 5 bucks and they looked legit.  Look forward to going back.
I love this place, my friends and I have always come here for their quesadillas. It's always better with chicken. I always take to go their chips, salsa, and bean dip.

I love to go to Valle Luna for girls lunch out dates. Great Margs and  lunch prices. I also almost always use a Restaurants.com gift cards and NEVER have any problems. I wish it was closer to my house but the drive is so worth it. Portions are great and the never ending chips are well ... never ending! Bar atmosphere is fun and as a whole this place is very clean. On the occasional day it gets chilly here in Phoenix I head right to this place for the fabulous Albondigas soup. Warms me right up. Keep up the great work Valle Luna!

We used to come here a lot, but haven't in several months (probably close to a year) and now I remember why!  Taco was over cooked to the point that it completely fell apart when I picked it up.  When I told the waitress she said that most people order them soft not crunchy because they are so brittle. The tostada was a soggy mess!  My mom ordered the burro de la casa and it was so greasy and the cheese had hardened so much by time it was delivered that it was almost completely inedible. The tea tasted like it had been sitting for 3 or 4 days. Overall a very bad food experience from a place we use to love.
Not the same as it used to be. There is no longer complimentary bean dip and it's not even the same recipe. Total bummer and disappointment.

Ughhhh!! go anywhere else but here! food was bland bland bland and horribly greasy! not a fresh item to be had. It was like drunk college food only worse.  It takes some serious work to mess up tacos rice and beans in my opinion but Valle Luna more than succeeded. Way too overpriced for the junk they serve. All I wanted were two veggie tacos and i got the greasiest hard tacos ever that were falling apart with refried beans from a can and not a vegetable to be had. Rice was tasteless and horribly mushy. We will never be back. Honestly I wish that I had complained but our server was too nice and we were so intent on leaving that I just did not...save your wallet and your stomachs and skip Valle Luna!!

We went to the bar and our bartender was one of the best servers I have ever experienced. He was very attentive and friendly. Shrimp tacos where delish, cod in the grilled fish tacos not as good. Atmosphere was fun and friendly and festive. I will definitely be back.

I have visited this place countless times over 2 yrs...but I'm sad to say I won't return ..the staff is gotten really bad... I don't know if the hiring pool is just awful or this place hires good employees and just have the worst leadership....the 2nd is the food used to be good .... used to be..maybe they are going through tuff financial Times or they are under new owners/management,  either way the food is now bland and the quality falls below Taco bell ( at least you know what your getting with taco bell) ...last time I was there the bartender spent more time with his buddies than taking care of paying customers and worse management didn't care.... my overall advice is to stay away...I would have given them a worse Rating but 1* is all they get....Try    DOS gringos or Nando's If in  Chandler...

I'm going to go out on a limb and give Valle Luna four stars.  Why? Because I like their thin-cut chips and spicy bean dip, lakeside dining and sea bass that comes with a unique concoction of sauteed vegetables, rice and decent jalapeno lime cream sauce.  The best menu item I've ordered (which I coincidentally don't order anymore because I fear the calories) is the South of the Border pollo sandwich. The chicken is soft, flavorful, and the green chile slice gives it a true southwestern ring. Make sure you get the requisite avocado slices.  One complaint is the drink prices - unless you sit in the (usually busy) bar side of the restaurant, a semi-decent margarita might run $7 or $8. I guess I'm spoiled, paying $3 for a margarita at Salty Senoritas.  Sometimes, I've felt the service was a little under par. A lack of warmth and friendliness, maybe? But most of the waiters/hostesses are young and perhaps don't consider this a career, so I don't blame them for not being perky.  I should note - my family loves this place, and they tend to be picky about Mexican food and atmosphere. Considering the other reviews I've seen about Valle Luna, I'm not sure why my family is so entranced with it. But it has become our hangout each time I'm in the southeast Valley.

Now I must admit that this place holds some nostalgia for me. It is where me and my fianc√© had our first date.  We have been back a few times since then and it's been okay at times, good at others. Tonight was pretty darn good. The atmosphere of this restaurant is nice especially if you get seated by the lake view tables. I have to say I was a little bit turned off that we were given dirty menus from the hostess stand. Someone was slacking. Salsa all over. But the service and food did make up for it.  We had a buy one get one free entr√©e coupon which was happily honored. Our waiter was very nice and kept our drinks refilled and checked in with us often. I had a cheese enchilada and a chicken flauta. My fianc√© had a shredded beef and bean burrito. Both meals were very tasty. The enchilada sauce was great. The enchilada had just the right amount of cheese.   We had a good overall experience. There may be a few other Mexican restaurants in town that are a little better but I enjoyed the food and service. I would recommend Valle Luna.
Good tacos and price but it was missing a little more variety and parking isn't the best. Good margs

I went for dinner after not having visited for over a year. I recalled why I stopped going. The chips were burned and I had to ask to have them replaced. They stopped giving bean dip with the chips. And when I got my food it was lukewarm and tasted like fast food. I used to like this place 20 years ago but it is not the same now. Will not be going back unless it is for happy hour.
Best Mexican food in the state. I've been a fan since 1989.

Decided to order a platter for a going away lunch for a coworker got the platter that feeds 12 but i think it's more like ten. Everything to serve the mini tacos taquitos and burritos along with beans and rice is included except for plates. The food was great and everyone commented how spicy the machaca was.

If it wasn't for the pretty lake at Valle Luna and the outdoor patio, I probably wouldn't ever go there. Their food is mediocre. The corn taco shells have been shiny with grease on the last 3-4 visits. The service for three of us at 1:00 PM today (Monday) was extremely slow. We were on our second basket of tortilla chips when our food finally arrived. The $5 house margarita lacked flavor; very disappointing. Didn't care for the black olives in the cheese enchiladas. The best time to go there is when you have a buy one entree, get one free.

I have been Valle Luna in the past and was not very happy with the food and service.  I said I would never go back yet, I decided to give it another try this time when I had friends in town. Once again completely disappointed with the food and service.  I had called ahead to make reservations for a party of 6 and was told they only accept reservations for 8 or more. Okay, I let that one go. We get to Valle Luna the waiting area is not busy at all. I place my name and party size with the host. He did not give me a wait time, just says," okay, have a seat." We waited 30 minutes before I finally had to approach the young man to ask how much longer. He said, "we are still waiting for tables to clear." We wait another 5 minutes then  finally are taken back to our table. First we are seated next to a table with a family with 4 kids, all of which were behaving badly running around screaming, no one said a word to the parents or kids.  Our waitress, Krystle promptly comes to our table to take our drink orders. This is when her poor waiting skills come into play. Krystle never approached us with a smile, a hello, welcome, just a "what would everyone like to drink." She returns with our drink then asks if everyone is ready to order. We all order. I personally had the spinach enchiladas. They were not good to say the least. The description mentions the enchiladas being filled with spinach, tomatoes, potato and zucchini in a blend of cheeses. These enchiladas should have been called cheese enchiladas, that is what they mostly consisted of. I saw the finely chopped pieces of spinach amongst the cheese sauce. However, I never once tasted or saw a potato, tomato or zucchini at any time while eating this dish. It was very bland and again I felt as if I was eating a tortilla filled with Velveeta cheese sauce. My husband and friends were not entirely pleased with their meals either. They all said that the food was okay but too pricey for the quality.  Back to our waitress, Krystle. The worst waitress I have ever encountered while dining out. She could have been more pleasant, and attentive. We had to flag her down on more than one occasion for drink refills, extra salsa, etc. Each time we asked her for something she acted as if we were inconveniencing her. We didn't receive even a thank you from Krystle at the end of our meal. I will NEVER go back to Valle Luna and will not recommend to anyone.

Sunday Funday til 6pm... awesome for sure! Good deals on drinks... and food. It's in the bar only. But still totally legit. It was dark in the booth we were sitting in though, damn if I can't read a menu now and I'm only 27 what does that say about my future in a dark booth... anyone know of a good lasik eye surgeon... lol?!?!

In December, would have given them 5 stars for happy hour.  In January they doubled their prices and stopped the bean dip.  We had been going weekly and now not at all. The drinks are watered down and the quality has plummeted while the prices rise. So sad. We have been going here for 10 years.

I don't know how anyone can eat at this place! The food is disgusting; bland, overly salted, and greasy are the best words to describe the 4 dishes my party ordered (and that includes a taco salad)! The meat on it smelled like dog food. I assumed when I paid extra for steak it was going to be big decent pieces. Nope. It was like weird Taco Bell meat cut into tiny cubes the size of raisins. In all honesty I should have just gone TO Taco Bell instead of wasting money on this food- especially since the dressing I asked for on the side came in a plastic take out container. When I am paying to sit down, please don't serve me anything in crappy plastic containers. The margaritas were terrible as well! Watered down, way too sweet, and pretty much see through. I also asked for a salted rim and was given this weird sugar mixture on it instead. This overly sweet drink they tried to pass off for a margarita might work well at a sorority house but not as a restaurant that boasts being voted the top Mexican Food in 2014. My two thoughts on that:  1) According to who (because whoever decided that doesn't have tastebuds) and 2) HOLY CRAP how Valle Luna has gown down hill in just 2 short years.
This place has an awesome atmosphere great music in the bar area big flat screen tvs with all sports good cold drinks and amazing hot food

Bad service and bad food! The Milton margarita tasted like an old dish rag .  My wife ordered a taco salad and when it came to the table it had an inch of water in the bottom of the bowl. To top it off the waitress basicly threw our food down on the table probably was mad she had to serve such garbage.

Been coming to Valle Luna for years and have always enjoyed both the food and the service.  Today I ordered the Fundido and it was quite dry so I asked for a little bit of Sour Cream I help correct the problem rather than send the food back.  Much to my surprise, I was charged extra for the Sour Cream.  So when I pointed out to my Server, Bree, that I was being charged for their mistake, not a word was muttered.  Just handed me the bill.    Bree has ended my patronage of Valle Luna.

Horrible service. I filled up a survey with my contact information. I was never contacted by management. My waitress Krysten was horrible. She was always on a rush, never brought to the table what i asked for, and presented the wrong check to me. Never going back here.

My Dad and I went here for dinner tonight. It had been a stressful day, but Seth helped changed that. He was super attentive and carried with him a fun and positive vibe. He was simply the best server I've ever had here! Thank you Seth for helping turn my night around. You were such a blessing tonight! I hope management gives you the recognition you deserve! If you choose to dine here, please request Seth if he is working. You won't regret it!

Valle Luna isn't the best, most authentic Mexican food in the land, but it's plenty good enough for those that don't know any better. I've only visited for happy hour, but always leave with a happy tummy after chowing down on spicy chips and salsa, margaritas,and half-priced appetizers.  I'm particularly fond of this location because of the sweet lakeside view. Its beauty at sunset combined with the savings from coupons they repeatedly send in the mail are reason enough to return for more.  HH is 3-7:30 M-F and 12-6 on Sat. Cheers!
My fav Mexican cantina in Chandler! chicken taco basket and the Luna-Rita are the best!

Sue had the spinach enchiladas and I had the fajitas. Both meals came out quickly, they were hot, fresh with just enough spices. Our waitress, Erin, was friendly, attentive, and professional. Look for coupons, they always have a BOGO out there. But, be sure you take care of your server and tip on the full amount!
Me and my girlfriend love this place. Much better than the other local chains. Its a pretty nice atmosphere and all ages seem to go here. One of our favorite places to eat.

I am writing this review because our server last night needs to be recognized for how he took care of us.  We were a last minute party of 30 and Christian was assigned to take care of us.  In all of my years and all of my different restaurant visits I have never experienced service like we had last night.  We always receive great care when dining at Valle Luna but I am still amazed and we haven't stopped talking about Christian!  All 30 of us ordered cocktails, dinners, split dinners, kids dinners and separate checks.  In other words, we weren't an easy table.  Christian did not miss a beat!   Drinks were refilled and ordered before current ones were empty, all orders came out correct and not a single bill was wrong!  I still don't know how he accomplished this!  To top it all off, one of the kids fell out of his chair and Christian had an ice pack to our table minutes after getting him back in his seat!  We were stunned!  We didn't even ask for it!! We often receive great service here but we have NEVER had service like this.  Managers, please give Christian kudos for a job well done and tell him how valuable he is to your establishment!  Thank you Valle Luna and thank you Christian!  The Thomas/Felice family!

The food is good (thumbs up for the taco salad) but the view is awesome. Sitting out on the patio & gazing out at the lake makes the meal that much better. The last time I was there we couldn't get lakeside seating because of a quincea√±era. Because of the view, it's an excellent place for parties, meetings, etc. I believe they also have karaoke.

Besides being my husbands favorite place, this place is downright delicious! Great prices, great atmosphere, and great service. Even during a rush they manage to make diners feel like it's empty and you have their undivided attention. We look forward to date nights as it's our usual spot!

Good margaritas and the patio is nice most of the year. The complimentary bean dip is awesome but for the most part the food is fair. My go-to dishes here are the pollo fundito or fish tacos, they have whole pinto beans as a side and they are amazing. Service is hit or miss, the buy one get one coupon in the circular is a bonus!

Valle Luna Chandler  My wife and I were kid free the other night and were deciding where to go and deducted down to Valle Luna because of the lakeside setting. We got there and parked in the lot and the very first thing you see in the front parking lot is an overflowing open gated nasty dumpster with boxes and rotton food spewing out. We nearly turned around and said S@REW THIS, but we didn't.  Inside we asked the host for patio seating which she said was booked; however, there was first-come-first-serve on the bar patio. Scored a ringside seat next to the lake! Yippie! I'm so gettin' some tonight with this setting. However, the ambiance was really marred by 2 things. First was the wafting of clouds of cigarette smoke lofting into our serene spot. Ewww, not to be a hypocrite as I smoked like 12 years ago..no check that cigarettes are gross. The other issue was the EXTREMELY INTOXICATED middle aged foul mouthed trashy cougar hooker seated behind us. Her and her skank girlfriend sat down about 1/2 hour after we did and she was friggin' hammered upon being seated. She later exclaimed to her friend about how she'd been drinking wine ALL DAY...yea really, you handle and hide it well. I totally shook my head as I watched the server dude take her order and thought, "Dude you're not really going to serve that sloshy puddle more booze are you?" and he did - and multiple times. Unbelievable! Where's the Liquor Board when they're needed.   The other issue about the facility is the stank in the bar area. It has the aroma of a high school boys locker room. They really need to address this as it's nasty...carpet looks like it hasn't been cleaned this millennium.   You can't go wrong drinking a Corona Light in this atmoshere and my wife had a Don Julio Blanca Marg Rocks that was good to. Later she prdered teh same but with a Chambord shot in it...awesome drink!  My wife loves that they serve a bean dip with the chips and I thought the salsa was very tasty and chunky. I hate it when the salsa is watery thin. Chips were good ny wife said as I don't eat them.   My wife had red cili enchiladas that were just ok...nothing special. I was pleased to see sea bass on the menu...yea! Ordered it but the server forgot to ask me which of the 2 sauces I wanted or about the sides. I flagged him down and told him the sauce and also said that I didn't want any rice. Food comes, there's the friggin' rice all over my plate. I'm not really picky but seriously I asked specifically for no rice and there it is and it's not like you can just push it aside as it crosses the international borders into the veggies, beans and fish sauce...forced to have a re-make. 8 minutes later and my wife is 1/2 done and here it comes back out. Looks good...taste is stone cold...what a shame as it was a good looking piece of fish.   Without that lake...we would never come back.

My favorite Mexican food restaurant in AZ! We have had some ups and downs over the past couple decades almost, but more ups than downs. The downs have been fixed in, in my opinion. Gabe is the man and has probably been serving us for 7 years by now. They have the best tacos in the state. It feels like you are with family when you are there after all these years.

Recently I decided to have a surprise birthday party for my girlfriend, and being that she and most of her friends are Mexican I wanted a place with good food. She is from Sonora, and the restaurant is described as Sonoran-style, so I put it at the top of my list.  I spoke to someone a few weeks prior who gave me additional information on private parties. They offer three different levels of menus for large parties. In selecting the Sonoran Celebration I picked two menu items and it came with rice, beans, a zucchini dish, and chips & salsa. Unlimited soda, tea, and coffee also come with that option. I had half of the patio overlooking the lake, booked it for 5pm with dinner served at 6.   I arrived a little early and had the opportunity put up decorations and set up the cakes I brought. While I was doing that two staff members were busy setting up the food line and brought me drinks. As the guests arrived they were offered drinks and chips & salsa while the food was being prepared.   The setting was perfect, my girlfriend surprised, and everyone reported having a good time. They enjoyed the food and as I booked for 35 but didn't have quite that many show up there were some leftovers that we brought home. It was a good choice (thanks to those Yelpers who provided suggestions on my Talk post), and I will definitely visit again.

Excellent customer service and excellent food! Our server was great even though the hostesses seemed a little behind. It was senior night (50+) and the special is either buy one get one free or, since there was only 1 senior at our table, 50% off his entree. I had the Fundito which was very rich and pretty salty, but was still delicious! I also loved the interior set up of the restaurant, and can't complain about the view of the lake right outside! The only thing I disliked about Valle Luna was the salsa.

I had a business meeting and we were planning on going to Pita Jungle next door but the wait was 30 mins. So we popped over here and was seated immediately.  Over the service was really good. I had a chicken taco salad and it was really fresh, definitely will get this next time I come back.  The only thing I didn't like was the water was out of the tap and tasted gross.  I guess I'm a water snob. Lol

Ate dinner here for my dad's birthday. Service was excellent and so was the food. They serve bean dip and salsa with chips both were very yummy. Their margaritas are excellent.   I had a green pork burrito with beans and rice. Everything was super tasty. My daughter had the cheese crisp extravaganza which she loves...has tons of steak and grilled vegetables. Their Polo Fundito is also excellent, the cream cheese sauce is perfect, not too hot. Really didn't have anything bad. Servings are huge so you will have leftovers for lunch the next day!!   There is a lovely outdoor patio that would be really nice when the weather is cooler.   Will definitely be back soon!!

My husband and I recently took out-of-town visitors to Valle Luna based on our past experience of it being a great local spot with great food, but I doubt we will return after our newest experience. We arrived just prior to the evening rush, and were quite surprised by the staff's lack of prioritization skills as we sat in the entry at least 15 minutes while others who arrived after us requiring seating for 5 were seated before us. When we inquired about this, the hostess proceeded to seat us near the smelly restroom, with other suitable booths in plain sight. Unfortunately, the odor overshadowed any quality of food that may have been there. Needless to say, my husband and I were mortified by the staff's haphazard treatment, especially since we had recommended the restaurant so highly to our guests. Valle Luna used to be our favorite local spot, but I doubt it will be on our short list of preferred places to go the next time we are asked to recommend a restaurant. We are very disappointed since that evening was to be the last get together before one of our guests deploys to Afghanistan.

I'm a huge fan of Mexican food so it's hard to let me down and Valle Luna definitely didn't! The spinach enchiladas were super tasty and I was so glad to be able to find so many vegetarian options. The location is really cool and we nabbed a table overlooking the water so we had a super great night. You can tell that this is a neighborhood place by all the groups of friends gathered and having a great time. We'll be back for sure.

Excellent mouthwatering original chimichanga burrito! They are stuffed fat and will leave you with a belly that will be full for the rest of the evening! Their ingredients are fresh and full of flavor.
Great happy hour specials.  Great food and yummmmy food. Wednesday has family night specials.
Great drink prices and good food. Our server Erin was awesome she was 5 stars without a doubt the kind of server you always want and expect

Our server came over to us twice. Once when we arrive and then once after our food was delivered. He otherwise ignored us the whole time. We had to get another waitress to help us out.   The chips and salsa were okay. The food was large portions, with okay flavors. Was disappointed overall with the experience and food and will not be coming back.
Very nice place. Staff was very friendly and efficient. Food was great. Will be back in the fall to enjoy the patio.

Big Fan. . .   I have been here numerous times throughout the years and can't believe i never wrote a review sooner.  I love this place.  This location is excellent.  It sits right on the water so when the weather is nice the patio seating cannot be beat.   Every time I have been here the service is always excellent.     The food is great.  I usually order the Machaca Burro De la Casa with rice a beans and each time I am left satisfied.  Also just in case you prefer Black beans instead of Pinto or Re-fried.  Those are very good as well and have become my preferred choice of late.    For me personally this is one of the better Mexican Restaurants in the area and I would much rather drive here then each at Nandos which is closer to my home.    The only downside for others who have been here in past years. . They used to offer you bean dip with your chips and salsa, but not anymore.  Now they will charge you $4.00 as if its an appetizer dish and while it is good, for me it isn't' worth it.   Other than that, enjoy the food and the view.

4 stars if you want a greasy heart attack. I often do, so I get the grilled pork chimichanga, I think it only has 7,000 calories.  Patio is awesome as long as you don't let ducks bully you into feeding them your delicious chips. (Beer doesn't help this). Down to 3 stars because the Sangria sucks, should be called a fruit juice meltdown, blech.

This is a Mexican food restaurant that seems very popular with the Chandler crowd. It serves tacos, burritos, quesadillas, nachos and other typical selections that Americans have come to believe originated south of our border. The food tastes good, but then again, I'm a sucker for most things covered in sour cream and cheese. It's definitely a step closer to legit Mexican food than some other places, but there's really not much here that you can't get anywhere else.  I will give a thumbs up on the happy hour. Great deals on appetizers and drinks make it worth the stop if you're in the area. Give it a look see.

This location was nice we went on Valentine's Day wasn't too busy was nice to see the view of the water it was a rainy night my now fianc√© had ordered the fajitas there were more onions then there was chicken he was very disappointed however I liked the fundio that I ordered it was very tasty the chips and salsa are yummy kind of spicy but good. We would go back to this location but I think that he won't order the fajitas again he was disappointed The four pieces of chicken and a whole big old pile of onions.

Good service and great food. Only thing is they didn't have refried beans that were on menu. But service was amazing, drinks were on point and food was so good. It's beautiful to sit on patio and enjoy your food with the view of lke and waterfall

Tasty food, good prices.  Great lunch destination.  Even the 'lunch special' portions are on the large side, all you can eat chips and salsa / bean dip while you wait for the meal (won't be long).  Try the lunch chimichanga special with green Chile, rice & beans, it's a piece of heaven on a plate.

Food is ok. Portions large. What pissed me off is that to get the "Sunday Funday" deals you have to sit in the bar or bar patio--smoky and awful. I cannot be around smoke. We had to sit at the far west end of the restaurant patio to avoid the smoke blowing over from the bar patio. So apparently we must risk lung cancer to get the discounts. Because of that I won't go back. I experienced breathing problems when we sat inside the restaurant a few months ago so that is not an option. Why can't anyone get the discounts even if they are not in the bar or bar patio? Isn't that discrimination? Parking is always horrible there too.

I've been going to valley Luna since I was 8 years old! I usually go to the one on cave creek road and when I moved to chandler I was thrilled to find one in my neighborhood. The patio is beautiful. And the chips and salsa are to die for. Make sure to ask for hot sauce I like to mix the mild salsa with the hot. Favorite is tia Rita's tacos plate or the green chili cheese Crisp yummmm

Red chille Carne is the best. Every Wednesday they have special priced menu where meals are 7.95 and kids eat for 1.50. Such a great deal and it is very filling. The food is always fresh and hot when they sever you. Bean dip and salsa with chips when u first arrive, um I'm good. Definitely recommend this place for any occasion.
They have a pretty good salsa. However, beef fajitas had hardly any beef in them. I was out of sour cream and other extras, but the waitress didn't ask if I wanted more.

Best Mexican food around love it great service best place around they have the best service and the best food try the spinach enchiladas there they're the bomb the waitress I don't know her name she's been there forever she is fantastic I love having her every time I go there I wish I knew her name but we sit on the patio every time we go and she's always our server 90% of the time and she is just fantastic and the food is the bomb I give A5 star rating

Service was not good. The waiter (Ariel) asked me for my ID (which I'm always flattered to hear) and as I go to my purse to get it he says "I'm not kidding". That was a bit uncomfortable considering I didn't think he was joking. I ordered shrimp tacos with flour tortillas because I do not like corn and I still got corn. He could not remember our drink order and came over 3 times instead of just writing it down. The drinks were strong but not good. The food was not worth the price. I would much rather go to Abuelo's where we are never disappointed. I would not recommend this place. My family and I will not be returning.

THE ONLY PLACE I GO TO FOR MEXICAN!  Let me start off first by saying that there is a server that works there named Jill and she is like this precious, sweet, wonderful lady who ALWAYS knows what me and my boyfriend want when she see's us! We just love her so much! She ROCKS!  The staff there seem to have worked there for a long time which always says a lot to me. The chips and salsa are good - but the bean dip? Oh man! I am in love with their bean dip! The atmosphere is really nice and the view is really nice to (over looks a little man made pond with a fountain in the middle.). Me and my boyfriend always order the same thing - the minnie taco basket, beef, with no tomatoes - and we always walk out stuffed and happy. They use shredded beef that is so juicy and flavorful!   Sometimes I am disappointed with the wait staff because certain servers aren't really on top of things, even on a slow day. But, my boyfriend and I don't let that impede out love for the minnie tacos and delicious bean dip!  I will be a patron for forever (or least until I don't live in Phoenix anymore)!

I have been going here for a year and a half, about 2-3 times a week.  I have learned not to expect good service or good quality of food.  I came back always because of the patio.  But as far as service, it is lack luster at best, as you can see by other reviews.  We sat there for about 5 minutes waiting to be acknowledged by our server who walked by several times.  We placed an order for Carne Asada nachos with drinks.  When we were eating the nachos we realized there was almost no chunks of meat on them, which cost $15 for nachos.  The cuts of meat were 1/8 inch in size and a very sparring amount. I considered this meat dust.  When telling the waiter this he just said that is the way it comes.  So the manager came over and as this was discussed it became apparent he didn't care either.  He wanted to take a whole $5 off the bill.  Maybe if I was back in Junior High $5 would have been a big deal.  I don't go out for a celebration and get concerned over $5.  What I am concerned about is the dining experience I have.  This place will always be busy, cheap drinks, average food and a good view.  So this won't make a difference in who goes there.  But this is the only recourse in having yet another bad dining experience here, for which I became accustomed to. I will attempt to find another Mexican restaurant to enjoy going out to.  I know, I only have about 300 other options.

I freaking love this place. I went for the first time with a group 2 months ago and every time anyone suggest meeting for dinner or lunch I always suggest here. They have really good enchiladas and you cant beat a $5 margaritas on Fridays.

my husband and my two small children decided to try out this Mexican Restaurant last night. We waiting for 25 minutes to get a table, which is understandable. We walked around the beautiful view of the lake while we were waiting which was really nice. Once we were seated, we decided to order some drinks and appetizers. We went for what we thought was "happy hour" to enjoy 1/2 price apps and reduced priced drinks, but we were told by the waitress you could not order from that menu at a table, only at the bar. As we were eating we noticed it was getting really warm. When we asked the waitress she said the air condition was broke. My husband asked why we weren't told by the hostess, because we may have decided to go elsewhere. She didn't have an answer and proceeded to get a manager. The manager was very rude and was trying to tell us that she thought the temp was fine. It was definitely not fine. We were sweating at the table. We weren't trying to get anything for free, we had already paid the bill. We were just looking for an explanation. We left very unsatisfied. We probably will go back because the food was ok, and the location is very close to our house. But if we had similar poor service after our next visit, we would definitely not go back a third time.
This restaurant has THE best food. I got hooked on their Mexican pizza awhile back and now have a real addition. Their dips are amazing as well. Would highly recommend this restaurant!!
Been coming to this place since before the one in ahwatukee shut down several years ago... Food is consistently great but I'm really sad they took away the free bean dip!

Not very impressed. I've been to the Valle Luna in the West Valley several times and thought it was good, so I finally went to the East Valley location. When I am rating a Mexican food restaurant always base it on chips, tacos, and enchiladas. First, the chips tasted over done. Second, the tacos were fairly tasteless and fell apart because the shell was drenched. Third, the enchiladas has black olives. I'm an Arizona native and have had Mexican food a couple of times and I don't recall of many places putting olives in their enchiladas.   In the end I may go back, but it won't be for a while.

My friend loves going here, the food is just food. Nothing to great, it's a nice place to hang out and drink at during happy hour though. Parking can be a pain but I love sitting outside, having a few drinks and watching the sun set. The food is just average bar like food but I enjoy their happy hour prices.

There's different kinds of Mexican places around.    Type A:  Pseudo-Mexican fast food (Taco Bell, El Pollo Loco, Del Taco, etc.)  Type B: REAL Mexican fast food (whateveri-berto's, Baja Fresh, Rubio's etc.)  Type C: Various traditional taquerias (Los Favoritos, Rivas' Mexican Food, etc.)  Type D: "Mexican Denny's" or chain-type sit down Mexican Restaurants--traditional-style or not (Chevy's, El Torito, Macayo's, etc.)   Type E: REAL formal or semi-formal Mexican restaurants (I don't know any in the Valley yet, but in the Bay Area there is the now closed La Michoacana in San Mateo, CA, etc.)  Valle Luna is a Type D, and a pretty good one as well.  Delicious traditional-style Mexican food.  The interior looks like what you usually see in a Chevy's or Macayo's.  It's visually pleasing, and service is friendly and helpful.  They have all the beers, margaritas, and tequila that you usually find at places like this (you know what I mean).  It's the kind of Mexican place you take someone for their birthday--exactly.  Do you check in to places on Yelp using your iPhone?   Come to Valle Luna!  Show them the check-in on your phone and you get $5 off of a meal costing $20 or more.  Perfect for lunch with your co-worker.  Valle Luna means good Mexifood.  If you're in the mood for a Type D, bypass the "Fresh Mex" and come here.
Never a disappointment at Valle Luna. Great food and great atmosphere. Bean dip and salsa are absolutely delicious and the margaritas are even better. Never had a meal there I didn't enjoy.

We've been going to Valle Luna on and off for years.    The last time that we ate there, we were less than pleased.  The food was bland, the sauces all tasted the same.  I ordered tamales, my favorite, they were as hard as rocks, so dense and heavy and unpleasant.  The rice was blah.  My daughter decided that rather than order from the kids meal, she would order a 1/2 price happy hour appetizer.  The happy hour menu was standing up in the middle of the table for all to see.  When we tried to order off the appetizer menu, we were told that those items could only be ordered in the bar and that the server was unable to accomodate us.  I decided to go into the bar and order the appetizer to bring back to our table.  On the upside, the bartender was very helpful and said that it was fine, nothing worng with bringing it back to our table and then offered to bring it to us when it was done!  So helpful!   We were very  disappointed that the server was so unwilling to help us solve the problem.    We went home with tons of leftovers because none of us thought the food was any good.  Don't know why we took it home, it just ended up in the trash.   I guess we'll continue our quest to find the best Mexican food restaurant!

Not sure why the weighted average is 3 stars, this place is a Chandler cornerstone restaurant. Wife & I always have a great time when we go. Salsa & bean dip incredible, entrees to die for (fundido & steak fajitas this time). Attentive staff. Margaritas pretty good. A little pricier that I would have hoped, but the waterfront helps justify. Shop local.

This spot is a staple of mine and my family's, along with many of our friends.  A really fun, really neat bar with a great vibe.  Tons of locals come into the place and much of the staff are on a first name basis.  The drinks are great - try the blue margaritas.  The food is INCREDIBLE - try the taco basket (chicken and beef combo) and the wings are legit (try them grilled).  The location is great, you can hang out on the back patio right next to the lake.  A really fun place to watch games - especially for Cards fans on Sunday.  Excellent happy hour and the actually just remodeled so the bar area is a lot more open and welcoming. Check it out!
Bad service. Took long time to take order. Food doesn't taste good. I ordered veggie fajita and veggies were just steamed. No spice nothing. Not going to come again. Avoid.

Greasy "traditional" American Mex is not really my cup of tea, so I would not usually choose this type of place for that reason.  However, I'm a medical sales rep, and we bring A Lot of lunches to offices.  Usually I try and steer them towards healthier fare since I have to eat lunch too, but one of my better accounts had a particular fancy for this place so I decided to be accommodating and give it a whirl.    I ordered their party platter which feeds 25, and told them to just put an assortment of stuff on there, beef and chicken.  My total was $125 before tax, and I found this to be EXTREMELY reasonable for what I got.  They were a little slow getting my order brought out to my car, but yes, they did bring it out and load it up and I only gave them an hour notice so I won't fault them for this at all.  It was a TON of food, two huge bags of chips, 3 large containers of salsa, 1 large container of guac, 1 large container of sour cream, a tray of rice, another tray of beans, and 3 huge party platter assortments of mini chimis, mini tacos, and flautas.  Even though the food was fried, it was not terribly greasy, and I actually enjoyed it!  It was a huge hit with the office, and there was so much leftover I actually brought some back for the staff at one of my offices since coincidentally they were having Mexican potluck day and as usual, I forgot to bring something in.  They commented on how good it was too, even though it was a full hour later and I looked super thoughtful ;)  I would definitely recommend this place for other reps who do catering orders or anyone who wants to feed a large group for what I consider to be a very fair price.  Huge hit, something for everyone!

My boyfriend introduced me and my girls to this place 2 years ago. It became one of our Go To Places. The service, for the most part, was mediocre. Chasing your waiter to come take your order or get drinks isn't my ideal of great customer service. But we loved going because of the patio sitting and their delicious bean dip which used to be FREE! I understand times are hard and can't always have things for free but to start charging your customer $4.25 for a bean dip, it better come in a large bowl that feeds more than 3 people! If anything, there should be free refills! Otherwise change your price. I never knew refried beans were so costly! You're better off ordering your meal which gives you their rice and beans...and not waste your money on the $4.25 over charged bean dip.  #MediocreService #WhatWasOnceFree #OverPricedBeanDip #ValleLuna

A great traditional Mexican restaurant.  5 star decor and views of an older Dobson Ranch lake area.  Service was 5 star.  2 or 3 combo deals Mex and Match are a good deal.   The tortilla soup is the best secret.   Get it as your side.  Ground beef burrito was just ok.  It was bland, even as I ordered enchilada style, I wish it had more sauce and cheese.   Cilantro lime dressing was weak on the salad switched to cilantro ranch.  The kids combo is huge.  Kids bean burro was small.  Side of fruit was just grapes.

Absolutely love love this place. The food is good, drink specials and service is always great. We come here once a month, the location is perfect with views of the water from the patio! They also have specials if you use foursquare you can get $ off your bill.

Get their special magaritas. And the free bean dip is amazing...  This is my new favorite local joint. As for food not the greatest if you are looking for authentic mexican. And it is not spicy at all....  But this is my new spot. Dibbs.

Ick.  I must also have visited on a bad day.  Valle Luna serves up by far the worst Mexican food I have ever eaten.  And I've eaten Mexican food in Connecticut.  That's saying something.  I think the best part was the bean dip (I think it was beans) they serve with their chips.  There was nothing memorable after that.  The best and really only good thing about Valle Luna is its location.  It sits right on the Anderson Springs "waterfront" so if you can get the patio, go for it.

We drove about 30 minutes to have dinner here and should have saved the fuel. This spot was a favorite for my wife's family growing up. It took about 45 minutes to get our meal. On arrival my order was incorrect. The children's plates were excessively hot-not sure why you would hand a 4 year old a plate they could burn them self on?!  The servers were friendly and apologetic of the length of time it took. Overall, the food wasn't worth the drive. We will find a new local favorite for our family that is closer to where we live and that tastes better.

Craving Mexican food... stopping by is a must. Service was outstanding, refilled drinks without noticing...lol. Not to mention Happy Hour Specials were great! No skimping customers on food(fish tacos=$3) and margaritas are . Enjoy!!

i enjoyed the visit.  the lake was a pleasant surprise.  went for lunch and ordered the 1 entry with rice and beans with fried ice cream.  i thought everything was yummy and filling.  the ice cream was topped with carmel!  would go back.

The Sonoran enchilada and shredded beef chimichanga covered in red enchilada sauce are exceptional. The ground beef chimichanga enchilada style is also very good. My girl let me try her Mexican Pizza and that was delicious, too. The Sonoran Enchilada is one of my favorites besides the chimichangas. The complimentary chips and salsa are also better than most Mexican joints.

While this place is kinda pricey they're queso fundido is amazing!!!  The wife and I love the amount of cheesy goodness they put on all their food.  The rice, beans, and service was perfect.  Wish you guys would put one down here in Tucson since I'd frequent it all the time!
Food was good. Service was lacking. Our drinks didn't come for at least 20 min+ and could not find our waiter when needed. Views were nice of the lake and atmosphere was nice.
Had a great dinner with family and didn't break the bank. Great margaritas! We also had an EXCELLENT waiter named Mason!! Can't say enough good things about him.

This is my parents' go-to place to enjoy a sangarita and beer on weekends. I went this past weekend and we just ordered appetizers. Food is okay and the service can be a hit or a miss. I will say that this past weekend the waitress did take care of us. But I've gone other times where service wasn't the best.  Their spicy salsa is actually pretty good considering I'm used to eating pretty authentic spicy salsa. I enjoy their cheese crisp and nachos here. Not a bad place to go to!

Very average Mexican food, but cool atmosphere. Tacos come in hard shells, the Verde salsa is average. The do have a great happy hour, lots of TVs in the bar area. If you are trying to stay on a budget, this happy hour is a great deal! If you want good food, perhaps not the best pick. Ambiance is a typical Mexican-American restaurant. Flip Flops, shorts and t shirt. They do have a cool patio area on a urban lake.

The service was average but the food saved this from being a three star review. We were a demanding table of 5 (MORE BEAN DIP!!!@!) but our waiter and help were able to keep up. All in all, we had about three rounds of chips and dip before our food came. It felt a little long, but it was worth the wait. Dinner arrived sizzling hot and everybody enjoyed their food. The shrimp fajitas need more shrimp and less onions taking up room on the plate (sneaky sneaky). Good salsa, great bean dip, and delicious enchilada sauce.

Ate here with my wife and sister.  I'm a big fan of Mexican restaurants, and this place did not disappoint. The chips were served with bean dip and salsa, both of which were good. They stayed on top of refills as well.  Ordered the house margarita on the rocks, which was also delicious. Very strong as well, be careful!  I had the chicken Chimichanga which was delicious and a generous portion... it was so large but also delicious that I was still full when dinner rolled around the next evening...  I also enjoyed the nice lake view. Was not able to sit next to it but added to the atmosphere. Overall would recommend and return.

Had 2 ground beef taco platter with rice & black beans, never got the beans, rice was dry and the amount of ground beef fill was a joke. No brainer why they're fighting Prop 206...never again, never again

I had heard about this restaurant from some neighbors and certainly have passed by it many times. Finally I decided to stop by for lunch during the weekend. I arrived after the lunch rush and the place was nice and tidy. The d√©cor, tables and booths are very outdated and the dim lighting doesn't help. I was seated in a booth by the window overlooking the outside patio and pond, nice view.   I ordered the chicken fundido with refried beans and rice. The chicken was grilled, nice taste, but the tortilla was over cooked. The beans and rice were what you would expect. The chips and salsa were pretty good but I've had better.
