After my meal I wondered about and found the bar area, seemed nice but a little tight seating and yes they had lighting a plenty.   Overall, not a bad experience but not so memorable either. They really need a makeover in their d√©cor, very outdated and just reeked of old! At best 2  1/2 stars.
Ate here for lunch, awesome food, awesome service, and a view of the lake. I had the fondito chimmie, it was wonderful. We will be back.
Food is alright, seems like they just threw it in the fryer and served it . Wouldn't go back .

I am not a big Mexican food fan to begin with, so take this review with a grain of salt.  My fiance, her family and a few friends decided to eat here when we saw that it was featured restaurant on Restaurant.com.  Each couple printed out our coupons as we were all going to pay separately.  Everything was going great, the service was fast and courteous and the food was good, but when it came to paying for our check we were told that they would only honor one coupon since we were all sitting at the same table, even though we alerted our waiter to the fact that we were all paying separately and he said that would be fine.  After a few tense minutes with the manager, he reluctantly agreed to accept the coupons.  Aside from that the experience was okay.  The party I was with really likes Mexican food, so I'm sure they would rate it higher.  I had the shrimp fajitas I would rate as a 6 compared to the best shrimp fajitas I have ever had.

We've been here six or seven times and you never know what you're gonna get. The service will range from terrible to average (one exception) and there's always confusion at the front door. The food varies too... I've had great and I've had gross. This is the ONLY restaurant I've been to where I would be concerned to send food back. It just has a sketchy vibe.  The last time we went our server was Liz, and she was AWESOME! I don't know if we'll every have her again but she made my day. Same visit we both ordered seafood enchiladas, and for a $14 lunch portion you expect more than six 61/70 shrimp. Eh, we'll be back, 'cause my wife likes it. lol

I love the Fundido and the chips and salsa are really good.  The Mexican pizza with jalapeno cream cheese is a great appetizer, they have an interesting variety of delicious margaritas, and the atmosphere in the cantina is subtly lively, if that makes any sense.  The staff is very friendly in the restaurant, but the service at the bar is hit or miss.
We come here a lot with our friends from church after our group meets. Good service, good food & the price is right. Outdoors is delightful when the weather permits!

This place used to be fantastic, I remember going as a kid all the time and everytime I've gone recently it's been awful. Food=bad wait=bad service=bad we went at 530 and left the restaurant at 8 and got our food at 740 waitress took forever to take our order. Literally 30 min just to wait for her to take our order. Like ur kidding right. And the food took forever to come out and a) wasn't good b) forgot to put one of my family's items on order (props to the manager for taking that item off bill) but honestly shitty service I won't be returning. It seemed everyone's food was taking forever Bc no one had their food and we all had been waiting forever. Ironic Bc it wasn't even busy LOL food was terrible my brother and boyfriend got the same item and they came out looking completely different, quality was inconsistent. Location is all this place has got but don't waste ur time I'd rather eat Taco Bell.

Fine for a quick shredded beef taco.  I ordered it to go, and they had the wrong order when I arrived.  They did fix it pretty quickly.  Taco was really greasy, but that happens with shredded beef tacos.  I know what I'm getting in to.  Good amount of cheese, lettuce, and tomatoes.
Went on a Saturday for HH.  Decent prices...decent food. The cantina was very crowded.  We enjoyed it.  Would definitely go back for Happy Hour.

They have three different locations and the first time I had their food it was catered for an event, and it was so good, that I had to go there. I went to one location out in Phoenix by one of my jobs, and ordered the shredded chicken tacos. AMAZING!!! They were soooo good, that I had to try their other location on Ray Road and it was just as amazing as the other two times I had it. I LOVE their tacos and their chips and salsa is to die for.

C, K and I stopped in for the happy hour specials. We grabbed a booth in the bar by the window. The bar was about half full and not very loud. Our server was Julie. Julie was amazing, she was easily one of the best servers we have had at Valle Luna. C ordered the classic cheese crisp ($4.50). Hot, bubbly, really good stuff. K and I split a 1/2 Taco basket all beef ($4.50) and the Chorizo Queso ($4.50). The taco's are pretty good. A good amount of beef, lettuce, cheese, tomatoes and a slightly greasy shell. For a buck fifty each, no complaints. The Chorizo Queso was a bit disappointing. The queso was a bit runny and just didn't seem made correctly. I like the plain Queso much better and will return to it the next time we're here for happy hour. Awesome server, decent h.h. food, good h.h. prices. 4 Stars.
The taco basket on happy hour with the chips, salsa bean dip. Cheapest dinner ever. delicious.

This place used to be our favorite. But on Tuesday we went there and the service was awful. They got two parts of our order wrong and didn't offer any resolutions. The following day we were all sick. Suffice to say we won't be going there again.
This place has been a local for years,  and year after year they come up trumps,  great food,  great bartenders and some occasionally interesting people at the  bar.

Best Mexican food in the area, from the perspective of someone who grew up in S. California. The steak tacos had a ton of flavor, even with just meat. The chips and salsa are excellent. I loved the frijoles a la olla. I will stop going to other Mexican places now!
I went with my Birthday coupon for a free dinner but even without one this is the best real mexican in town.  I'm from San Diego and very picky when it comes to Mexican food. Valle Luna Rocks!

I'm a regular. Love their green corn tamales and their taco basket is good. I go to the cantina to meet up with friends and enjoy happy hour. Always relaxed and can watch the game and talk with friends. Prompt service and good drinks. The "lake" nearby provides a good atmosphere. I love Mexican food but wouldn't say this is the greatest Mexican you'll ever have but pretty decent. I come from New Mexico, so I'm hard to please.

Who doesn't love the buy one get one free entree's coupons for Luna?! we love the Fajita's and the Fundido. and it's even better when we get one meal for free!!! awesome place, great service. yummy chips and dips for free. it just gets better and better when we come. love it

Valle Luna is an old favorite restaurant of mine. I have been coming here for years in part because it is near my work and home, but the food and atmosphere make it an easy choice when you are craving a good, authentic Mexican meal.   Whether you are here for Happy hour, lunch or dinner- there is something for everyone. Any restaurant that serves me a quality salsa with chips to begin my meal is solid in my book. Overall, it is a great looking restaurant with a lake side view if you dine in the back of the restaurant or on the patio, the food is decent and the prices are fair and the service is awesome!

Good for what it is. Super greasy comfort Mexican food. Service is OK but could be quicker and more attentive. I would probably recommend other Mexican food places over this one most days but its nice on occasion.

When we walked in here it really felt like a chain Mexican restaurant like 3 Margaritas or On The Border.  They start off by giving you a big bowl of chips and everyone gets their own little bowls of salsa and refried bean dips. I really enjoyed the dips and think I ate every drop of it.  I got the shredded beef chimichanga and I don't remember it wowing me. It tasted fine, but nothing really stood out for me.  The service was another thing that was kinda "meh". It felt like we sat there for a really long time before anyone came by to take our drink order and they didn't come by a ton asking if we wanted refills on our margaritas (which were the one thing that was excellent).

Valle Luna has fresh, hot food with great prices to match. I enjoy any combination plate for lunch or dinner, and those fajitas could fill an army! Our waitress was very knowledgeable and attentive once she served us, but the team could work on cooperation. We sat in the bar for over 6 minutes without anyone speaking to us, though I made eye contact and smiled at 4 different employees before being greeted. We will visit this location again, and enjoy a nice evening out on the patio.

Was given this recommendation for some really good Mexican food. For starters, the salsa and chips were tasty. I ordered the Carne Asada with rice and beans with a side of Kilt Lifter . My partner ordered shredded beef tacos that looked delicious. The food wasn't bad in flavor at all. Wouldn't mind coming back to dine on the outdoor patio once summer is over.

Absolutely rude and horrible service. They are the worst experience I have ever had. The manager John is awful and unprofessional with a know it all attitude! First and last time I'll ever go there. I am a total foodie and quite frankly with all my travels all over the world this has been the worst experience I have ever had. They deserve like -0 star.

My wife and I have been thinking of Valle Luna for a week. A co worker brought a platter to my wife's work and she loved it. She brought her plate home for me and we both were very happy with the flavor.   Flash forward to tonight. Carlos was our knowledgeable server. We described the plate that we had eaten and he instructed us that we needed the green chile chimis. We got the Vallitas and Lunitas as an entree, crispy chicken flautas and bean/green chile/red chile chimis. I got the numero Uno. Chicken taco was juicy and crispy and crunchy and the flavor was just right. Green chile enchilada was piping hot but I could not stop eating. Rice and beans were done right.   The real winner of the night was desert. Carlos undersold and over delivered. The fried ice Cream was not the usual rock hard interior. This was the right size to fry the outside and just soften the inside. Not only do you get the best fried ice cream but cinnamon fried tortillas AND caramel cheesecake stuffed chimi.   We found our new favorite Mexican food. Well done Carlos and thank you Valle Luna.
First time at Valle Luna happy hour! Lake view amazing! Excellent choice!!! Drinks and food, awesome!! Thank you Esteban for the great service!
The service here is awesome and the food along with it! I had the burrito bowl and my hubby had the enchiladas! Both very tasty. Be careful with chips and salsa. Muy delicioso!!!

My wife and her girl friend went there for lunch a couple weeks ago and she thought it was great so she and I went there for lunch today.  What a terribly different experience from her first visit.  The chips were stale, the cheese crisp tortilla was horribly stale and old, and the salsa tasted like stewed tomatoes.  The service was nice and friendly and the beef enchiladas and taco were better than average.  Maybe it was timing, but you would think that Saturdays would be one of their busiest times and that they would be better prepared with fresher food.
Great lunch menu even with fajitas that came out sizzling. Had leftovers for the next day as well. Great place for larger groups and friendly service.

We went there a few months ago with a restaurant.com gift certificate. Pretty good service, refilled water without asking. We really stuffed ourselves with food too.  I think I got Fajitas, very good. Girlfriend doesn't remember what she got but she thought it was good as well.

Huge disappoint. I've been going to Valle Luna for years because our family loved the awesome complimentary bean dip, chips, and salsa with our meals. They are now charging $4.25 for a tiny order of their bean dip. The order wasn't enough for my three small kids much less anyone else.
Valle Luna serves my brother's favorite soup - the one with meat balls - every day of the week. The chips and salsa served with your meal are good.
Service was great but food took longer than usual. Carne asada was delicious lots of flavor. The restaurant has a great view of a lake.  I would definitely come here over and over again!

It has been awhile since we last visited Valle Luna.  It is about a 20-25 minutes drive from our house, so it is not exactly convenient.  I'd promised a Mexican Food Wednesday and I got so wrapped up in the day that I forgot to cook dinner (or even shop for it).  So, we headed to Valle Luna for Family Night.  When we arrived, we were told there would be a 15 minute wait.  About 22 minutes later, we were seated in Gloria's section.  After being seated, we didn't see our waitress for about 5 minutes.  She came up to the table sort of frantic and asked if she could take our drink order.  I asked if we could put in our daughter's food order, since it was getting late and she was hungry.  She told me that she couldn't take the order because she had to go drop off two checks.  Huh?  So she took our drink order and came back with the drinks.  Then she said she would be right back.  Ten more minutes passed and she asked to take our daughter's order.  We told her we were ready to place our entire order, but to please bring our daughter's food out as soon as possible.  I also asked for hot salsa.   After that, we did not get visited by Gloria again.  She made eye contact with me twice - once when she was headed in from the patio and once when she was picking up silverware from a makeshift host table next to our table, but she did not come to our table and just zoomed off.  We heard her say aloud "oh, hot salsa" but she never returned.  No drink refills, nothing.  We waited for more than 30 minutes before asking the hostess to find her.  The hostess was under the impression we were just waiting for our check.  We said, no, we had not even been served our food.  We asked for a manager.  Then, Gloria comes to our table, picks up our drinks and asks if we want a refill.  "No thank you.  We would like to leave.  We have been waiting for too long without service."  She said she would get a manager.  We waited another ten minutes and then I took my daughter to the car, letting the hostess know we were leaving and that her dad was staying to talk to the manager.    He talked to the manager and the manager offered to check on our food and comp the food, but it was already far too late and we were in the car.  He said the manager seemed genuine and polite.  We won't be back to Valle Luna again.  I don't know why the waitress was serving both our table and the patio, but that has to be part of the problem.  There is no real team service there, which could have resolved our drink refill issue.    The bottom line is that Valle Luna is just OKAY food to begin with.  They really need to have stellar service if they want to keep customers... and they just don't have it.

Yeah, methinks not. It's not like the place is a disaster, so I feel bad giving it one star, but...it was pretty bad. I ordered the chile relleno and an enchilada. The chile relleno cheese wasn't even melted -- gross. And the chile, I couldn't even cut through it with a fork. The egg batter was smooshy. Yuck. Worst relleno I've ever had, including the microwaved crap you get at the 'bertos chains. (If you like chile rellenos like I do, go over to El Zocalo -- awesome relleno). The enchilada was good; however, the enchilada sauce was super salty, I mean like they salted it way too much, then salted it just a bit more.  We also had the albondigas soup with salad. The meatballs were undercooked, red inside. The salad was right out of a bag.  Even the iced tea sucked.  The place has such a nice ambiance and a great view, right there on the water. I hope our experience wasn't the norm.
Smoking, smoke in my face.  I use to enjoy the patio but the cigarette smoking is out of control....cant sit there and be sick from the smell and eat too. Yuk

Had an amazing lunch with my grandmother!! It was a beautiful day and the service was above average. Christian took such good care of us and our needs were always met. I really appreciated him saving us money by making our lunch order into a dinner meal.  We will continue going there not only for the atmosphere but for the staff.
